title: Great location and helpful staff
text: Great location and excellent staff.  Upon arriving early having moved from the Hilton Midtown, rooms were not ready but they offered to store my friends luggage and upon hearing that the airline had not yet located my luggage offered toiletries as soon as I said what had happened. She immediately put notes in my reservation stating that luggage may be delivered to accept it.  She was so helpful and I appreciated the gesture. We arrived in the evening to collect our keys and get to the room.  We stayed for 3 nights. The room was small but comfortable.  Upon check out the agent asked again about luggage and an email followed up if they still needed to accept it.  This is the kind of caring staff hotels need to have.  Thank you for the follow up.  The luggage was delivered to my house the day after I returned home from vacation.

title: Awesome Staff, Great Location - Close Proximity To Grand Central, Clean and Spacious Rooms, Great Value
text: I have visited New York plenty of times and have stayed in different hotels before, Hampton Inn Grand Central has one of the friendliest staff in town. Read my other review about another hotel in New York. It was horrific. One of the reasons why we switched to this hotel on the same trip was because of the unpleasant experiences at the other hotel (We traveled as a group in January). This review is overdue. We want to show our appreciation especially to Scott. We checked in smoothly with Scott at the desk and he was friendly, competent, professional, and welcoming. He was diametrically opposite to the staff we encountered at the other hotel before checking in to this hotel. Scott’s professionalism was pronounced. I was grateful for Scott as I traveled with a group of people from Hong Kong. I did not want them to feel that New York is a horrible place to visit because of the horrific experiences from the previous hotel. Scott saved the day! The hotel location is awesome if you like to be close to everything and Grand Central station is within a few blocks. I would not recommend staying at the Grand Central’s hotel for the reasons I stated in my other review at that hotel. Also, if you are reading this review because you want to stay close to the station, Hampton Inn is within a few blocks from Grand Central. It is an easy walk as well. The room itself is clean and spacious by New York standards. Everything worked in the room. The complimentary breakfast was adequate, and it is a plus especially if you travel with your family. We had a total of five rooms and all of us agreed our overall experiences at Hampton Inn were far more pleasant. Next time I come to New York, I would not hesitate to stay here again.

title: Fantastico!
text: A wonderful 7 nights. Very comfortable room. Bed/mattress a delight. Lovely linen. Breakfast great. Nice variety.  Reception staff lovely. Victoria,Ree and others couldn't be more helpful. Thank you. Rae Scott with Mary E.  Wellington NZ.

title: Fabulous!
text: Had a great stay here and highly recommend this hotel. Staff were all very friendly, room was clean and comfortable for a family of 4 and breakfast was great with a variety of options and kept well stocked. Came back to our room to find it decorated and cupcakes left for my daughter’s birthday which was so thoughtful and such a nice surprise. Location was convenient with an easy walk to Times Square in a safe location. We hope to be back soon! Had a fabulous time thanks to the Hampton Inn!!

title: Definitely coming back!
text: Such a warm, nice small hotel with all amenities, and lovely staff. Two of the staff members go out of their way to make visitors feel at home. Victoria at the reception always welcomes guests with a beautiful smile. There is an African American tall lady at the breakfast/kitchen. She does her job with dedication. Unlike many other hotels, this particular one offers a different menu every single day. Kudos!

title: Perfect location, good breakfast, friendly staff, clean and well-kept
text:
It is a simple but well-kept hotel in a perfect location (next to Grand Central) with everything at hand (transport, pharmacy, supermarket, tourist attractions...) with breakfast included (a big plus) and with very friendly staff .
Breakfast is simple, as it is courtesy of the Hampton brand, but it has everything you need (juices, coffee, cereal, pastries, bread, bagels, fresh waffles, fruit, and hot dishes that change daily). In our experience they replaced what was finished quite quickly.
The room is simple but meets expectations, the bed is very comfortable, the views from the 19th floor are spectacular, good water pressure, good cleaning...
Special mention to Ree who was very kind to us and assigned us a room with very nice views.

title: Excelente experiencia
text: Un hotel limpio, buen servicio, buena ubicación y buena atención. El desayuno básico pero rico y sobre todo con higiene, el comedor igual lo están limpiando continuamente. Todos los empleados súper atentos, en especial los del lobby el jueves que llegamos 18 de enero 2024 se portaron súper increíbles, ya que nuestro Inglés es muy básico y ellos se esforzaron en hablar un poco de español y con toda la paciencia nos atendieron.

title: No es igual a otros de la cadena.  Debe mejorar
text:
Solemos usar la cadena Hampton Inn en muchos viajes, pero este hotel no es tan bueno como otros 
Tiene excelente ubicación, cerca de la estación central 
Las habitaciones son muy pequeñas, están limpias y tienen caja de seguridad. No tienen frigobar 
Uno de los días de nuestra estadía olvidaron hacer la limpieza de la habitación 
Ofrecen desayuno de cortesía, con platos calientes, infusiones y juegos, además de algunos productos de pastelería. La variedad de lo que se ofrece en el desayuno es mejor a la de otros hoteles de la cadena 
Además ofrecen café todo el día, pero frío

title: Solo la posizione. Il resto un disastro
text: Hotel sporco. Colazione scarsa di pessima qualità e in un ambiente sporco dove i tavolini non venivano puliti tra un cliente e l’altro quindi ognuno doveva arrangiarsi da solo. Gli addetti alla colazione totalmente incuranti degli ospiti.

title: UN AGRADO VOLVER
text:
Es la segunda vez que hospedamos en este hotel, y realmente no defrauda. Es cómodo, muy bien ubicado y el personal es súper amable. Mención especial a Asia, en recepción, fue muy atenta, simpática y siempre dispuesta a ayudarnos.
Volvería siempre a este hotel.

title: Good stay for a fair price
text:
The hotel is simple, at first sight it is very simple. However, the rooms are clean and sufficient for some days in the city. Breakfast is good enough to start the day, come early!!!
Staff was polite and helpful.
Very good location. No resort fees, only a deposit of 25 USD x day, which is reimbursed later.
If you do not want to pay for any luxury, come and stay here!!!!

title: Bien trop cher pour les prestations, à fuir
text:
Notre chambre est une location d’ une semaine. Dès notre arrivée le chauffage de la chambre ne fonctionne pas (nous sommes fin décembre!). Il n’y a pas d’eau chaude non plus. Une honte pour ce prix !
L’hôtesse ne veut pas faire un geste commercial car la réservation ne s’est pas faite directement avec eux mais par une plateforme de réservation (comme pour la plupart des réservations)
A fuir !

title: Lovely
text:
Fab experience, 
Arrived 14 December the staff behind the desk where fantastic and very helpful giving tips. 
Such an asset to the company. Rooms clean and tidy bed super comfortable 
Breakfast wasn’t amazing but it wasn’t bad. 
Only down side was the internet in the rooms wasn’t working on my phone but it wasn’t the end of the world 
The location Was great if I was ever to come back to New York it this hotel would be a hi or in

title: ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE
text:
This trip was absolutely horrible, one of my worst ever! 

1. There was no service my whole five day trip, even though every time I would ask the front desk as to when it’s getting fixed they would just say, “the next morning!” - LIES
2. Breakfast is absolutely disgusting. It consists of scrambled eggs, microwave pancakes, sausage patties, boiled eggs & yogurt cups. Stale bagels too 
3. The bathroom doors don’t fully close, it’s a sliding door. They also have no lock
4. The doors slam, they’re very heavy. 
5. There’s barely any room to do anything. Know that before you come! 
6. Sheets were extremely dirty. 

The only good thing was the fact that it’s very close to the main NYC activities.

title: A very welcome change
text:
We were moved to this hotel for the last 2 days of our holiday due to holiday tour company putting us in a hotel that wasn’t suitable for children. 
It’s not on a Main Street so lovely and quiet. The rooms are large and the beds are comfortable. The staff are amazing and friendly. The breakfast is a nice extra treat. Definitely would come back to this hotel

title: NYC Hampton Inn
text: Great stay, location was very convenient (2 blocks from Grand Central Station, easy subway access). Hotel was clean & quiet, staff (from housekeeping to front desk to breakfast staff) were very helpful & friendly 🙂 Will definitely stay here again.

title: Great Manhattan Hotel
text: The Hampton Inn Grand Central provided everything I needed - a good location, a comfortable bed and friendly/helpful staff. I stayed for a long weekend in November 2023 and would definitely recommend it and stay there again.

title: Bugs in the room
text: Unfortunately I found bugs on the bathroom floor and I immediately asked reception to deeply clean the entire room ASAP which wad done the day after my request. However this should not have happened in such hotel

title: Great hotel
text:
Exceptionally kind and considerate staff. I took an early flight to NYC and arrived at the hotel ridiculously early, at 10:40 am. The staff let me check in early.
I was visiting my son and  wanted two separate beds. This was one of the few Manhattan Hiltons where this was available. 
We enjoyed the daily breakfast bar and everyday looked forward to seeing which hot items were available.
Centrally located near Grand Central Station and the United Nations in a lively neighborhood.

title: Excellent stay + service ⭐️
text:
Took my parents to NYC and we stayed at this hotel. Staff were personable, helpful, and positive. We rented a motorized scooter for my mom and they helped facilitate the return since we had to fly out before the scooter company came to pick up.

Our room was great for the price we paid. It was always clean and restocked on time whenever we requested that they clean our room. We also love the free breakfast buffet and the rotating menu of hot items. I also loved the gym downstairs despite it being small. It had functioning machines, free weights, ample space to do yoga, and even a cable machine.

Highly recommend, will consider staying again when I'm back in the city.

title: Worth it!
text: As a long time Hilton member, I try to stay with the brand.  I travel to NYC several times a year, and finally, I think I found my go to hotel.  I had previously stayed at a more prestigious property, just down the street, and was offered a better price than this Hampton, however, last time I stayed there, the staff was very snobbish and the service was somewhat lacking.  I did read better reviews than that property at this Hampton, and, they were right.  Great staff, room was a good size, breakfast was available and very well kept up.  We'll be back...  Thank you...

title: Hampton Inn Grand Central NYC
text: This is a good choice if you’re looking for a clean, relatively quiet, and very well located midtown place to stay. It is also one of the more budget friendly places to stay in midtown NYC these days. It’s less than a ten minute walk to Grand Central station. The staff is very friendly. Just beware, although breakfast is included, it’s really nothing to be excited about.  Choices are very limited, some items are slow to be replenished, and I never once saw someone clean a tabletop between guests. No one goes to a Hampton Inn for the food. Good news, you’re in Midtown Manhattan and surrounded by some really good options.

title: Comodo
text: Vicino a Grand Central, rappresenta un ottimo punto da cui esplorare Manhattan. Personale gentile, colazione molto buona, camere piccole, ma pulite e con letti comodi. È possibile chiudere aria condizionata e aprire uno spiraglio di finestra.

title: Room Surprise
text: I have stayed in the city many times. I was very pleased and surprised by how large the room was. The room was immaculate as far as being clean. The choice of pillows soft and firm were available to me.

title: better than expected!
text: the hotel location was great, midtown manhattan but near the quieter area of the UN HQ away from the noise and visual pollution of times square. grand central station was conveniently a couple blocks away. personnel had an agreeable trait and were helpful with our questions. the business center have all the material needed for virtual meetings and the gym had full equipment for training. the room was of fair size and I kind of like the whole 'clean by request' system (we still dont know if cleaning personnel entered in the room on non cleaning days anyway. or perhaps there's a central light switch at a certain time because we never left lights on, or maybe it was just the connecting room neighbours pranking) the breakfast could've been better but it had enough to fill one in (please consider serving non cheddar cheese more than once a week!) the bagels were soft and yummy. overall a nice experience, on par with previous hilton + branches accomodation ones.

title: Would stay again!
text: Had a short weekend stay for a concert and everything was great! The location was very convenient being located so close to grand central which made it easy to get wherever we needed. The breakfast was great to have included right at the hotel and it was tasty with a decent variety. I wish I could remember the name of the lady that checked us in (it was Friday 8/11/23 close to 8pm) because she was super nice and upgraded our room. The only negative I could note is the air conditioner in our room basically soaked the carpet underneath it and slightly out into the room so we had to be careful where we stepped and set our bags. Overall I was happy with our stay and would definitely stay again!

title: Cheap but worth it hotel in NYC
text: We arrived NYC last July 27 around 7am, so I really hope the room is ready for early check in and yes they were able to provide us the room coz we're so sleepy from the long flight. They charged us minimal for the early check in thanks to the staff. Room is clean, a bit tight space but relaxing ambiance. Food selections are okay for breakfast, and good thing they offer breakfast since not all hotels in NYC provide complimentary breakfast. They also accept storage keeping. Staff members accommodating and welcoming. Cheapest hotel that you can get in NYC but definitely worth it

title: No probs at all
text: Good sized room, comfortable beds, nice toiletries, cleaned everyday, fluffy towels, good air con. Breakfast can be busy but ok selection, re stocked quickly, typical American hotel breakfast. Very helpful staff.

title: A clean place to land in NYC. Bring your own pillow if you can
text: I have never stayed in a Hampton by Hilton, it was my first trip to NYC and the facade of the hotel and surrounding area are under construction, to the left of the entrance was a daily huge 5 foot pile of black garbage bags, some spilling open, and it was 90 plus degrees everyday. Front desk staff? Wonderful. Ajah? Exceptional at every encounter. The room (single King) was clean but soooo tiny that all you could do was sit on the bed once you got your luggage in. We asked for a fridge in the room (extra 16 dollars/day) and that took up so much space we couldn’t open the armoire. It also looked like someone dragged it up 16 flights of stairs. It worked. I always look forward to a Hilton bed when traveling. This did not fit the bill, we woke up with screaming backaches every morning and the pillows badly needed replacement. We didn’t ask for housekeeping because with our suitcases on the floor and the fridge,  there was no room for them to walk, so we asked for fresh towels (there is no place to hang them to dry.) They could only give us 2 bath towels a day, no hand towels or wash cloths, and we had to ask multiple times for them to come take the trash ( it seems like there is one guy doing all this 24:7 and he was clearly over it) Front desk Manager was awesome and securely held our bags so we could sightsee on checkout day. We didn’t have breakfast there.

title: Front desk A++
text: Once again, as always, great experience with the front desk. This time it was Asia that helped me when I was having online booking issues. She assisted me on the phone and quickly checked me in once I arrived.

title: Hampton Inn with Four Seasons’ service
text: The staff here are what makes this hotel. The majority of the staff (Victoria, Brianna, Xtina) make this property a 5 star hotel. The breakfast is always excellent & they replenish items quickly. The staff is quick to clean tables & they’re always happy & helpful especially Brianna.  Our housekeeper was excellent & always had a clean room upon our return & any supplies we requested were in the room.  Victoria was always helpful & would greet us each time we saw her. I will definitely stay here again. These employees are all best in class & if I had a business I would poach them to come & work for me.   I’ve stayed at the Ritz Carlton, Four Seasons, & Omni & the staff here gave the same excellent service.

title: Posizione perfetta e personale eccezzionale
text:
Ho soggiornato in questa struttura dal 11 al 19 giugno 2023 con la mia famiglia.La posizione dell'hotel è davvero fantastica e ci ha permesso di goderci New York nel pieno della sua bellezza.
Il personale è super disponibile e ti aiuta in tutto quello che serve.
La colazione è varia e abbondante.
Altra nota positiva è la possibilità di riempire le borraccie con acqua fresca tutte le mattine prima di partire a visitare la città.
Consigliatissimo a tutti

title: ottima esperienza
text:
Premetto che avevo delle riserve su questo hotel perchè, sinceramente, non mi sembrava un gran chè, invece devo dire che mi sono ricreduta. Siamo stati benissimo, eravamo io mio marito e mio figlio, avevamo una camera con due letti grandi, molto spaziosa, il bagno rimane un pò piccolino e il nostro non aveva la finestra, però questo non ha creato disagi. l'armadio ha anche un asse da stiro e un ferro, per chi ne avesse bisogno, c'è una comoda cassettiera dove ci stanno un sacco di cose. La colazione, inclusa, cosa non da poco, è molto buona, sono sempre presenti due tipi di waffle, alla vaniglia o alla frutta, con i vari topping per farcirli. C'è sempre la scelta salata con uova o altro, pane, bagel succhi, acqua, e dispenser di caffè anche decaffeinato disponibile tutto il giorno. Comodissima la posizione a due passi da Grand Central tant'è che, al ritorno, abbiamo preso il treno per andare in aeroporto. Il personale dell'hotel è gentilissimo una ragazza, di cui purtroppo non so il nome, ci ha fatto il check in online e ci ha dato indicazioni per prendere il treno anzichè il taxi per tornare a casa, volendo hanno un loro servizio taxi che possono chiamare al costo di 90 dollari, il taxi a me ne è costati 95 all'andata.
Insomma se dovessi tornare a New York scegliere di sicuro di nuovo questo hotel siamo stati benissimo

title: Nope.
text: No. Tiny rooms and lobby. It's an odd little hotel off a major intersection, and I thought it would be a better choice. Not Hampton quality, and I won't be back.  I did not feel secure - the whole place has a low-rent feel to it.

title: I regret staying here.
text:
We (2 adults and a 3 year old) had originally booked 2 nights June 17th-June 19th at The Hampton Inn Grand Central and upon check in to room 1003, noticed that the room had a really nasty smell enough to give me a headache (kind of like sweat, covered with men's cologne ).  We left the windows open, turned the ac on full blast and left for the afternoon.  Upon returning that evening, the room still smelled just as bad and we requested a room change.  We even decided to forego the extra points we had originally paid for a 2 doubles room, and settled on a small King room located on the 5th floor (room 508) which was originally almost half the rate.  But starting at 1 am and lasting throughout the night until morning, our room absolutely REAKED of marijuana.  It was so bad that now days later we and our child are still dealing with the after-affects.  We complained to front desk the next morning and they allowed us to cancel our second night without penalty, which i gladly accepted because god forbid we lose our points for a late cancellation.  Nothing else was offered but at that point we were just rushing to leave.

On the plus side, all of the staff that I had met were kind and professional, and the breakfast was decent although a bit crowded (which is to be expected) .    However having to expose a small toddler to that much marijuana is completely horrifying and i do regret not getting up in the middle of the night and just walking out w/ my family.   So to summarize, our stay here was a complete disaster.

title: 8 nights stay at Hampton Inn Manhattan Grand Central
text: This hotel provides an exceptionally good customer service. Good breakfast to start your day. Good size and very clean rooms. The location for our purpose of stay could not have been better. Staff make you feel at home and always ready to help out in any issues you might have. Will definitely choose this hotel if I ever need to stay in this area of New York.

title: Beware extra unauthorised charges on your Credit Card
text:
My ten day stay here was disappointing for many reasons.

Firstly, after seeing the cleaning staff let a person into a room without checking with the front desk to see if that person was staying in the room we had with concerns about the security of the rooms which turned into a worry for what happened throughout our stay when I later found out staff had gone through my personal items and taken photos of them.

Secondly, the cleaning of the rooms was generally poor and not done regulary. For example, on arrival my shower drain was full of someone else's hair.

I stayed for 10 nights and even tho I was out at work all day everyday they did not clean the room everyday, which is not the experience you want to return to after long working days away from home.

The iron for clothes in the room was old and stained one of my work shirts. My wife visited for a few days and found the hair dryer was also broken.
Thirdly, the hotel was a nightmare when full. The lobby got blocked by queues of people checking in and it became hard to get in and out of the building. Many guests got upset during this period and complaints at the front desk were regular. The lift at these times took up to 10 mins to come to my floor which was quite frustrating. The food ran out at breakfast which shouldn't happen but did on two occasions during my stay. After about 20 mins it was replenished, but on one monirng i did not have the extra time to wait.

Fourthly, the rooms are also very small. Basically just enough room for the bed and that is it. The hotel is old and in need of some updating. The air con units were old, noisy and didnt work well. Not all the light bulbs in my room and the corridors were working.

Finally, the staff lied and added false charges to my credit card, so beware. I was given a 125US smoking in my room charge. Yet I never smoked in my room. The manager claimed to have evidence yet the evidence was not the smell of smoke in my room or a smoke alarm going off but that the cleaner took a picture of loose cannabis flowers from in a draw in my room (cannabis was decriminalised in NY for anyone wondering). When I disputed the charge the manager had problems understanding English and stuck to the argument that seeing loose cannabis and the end of a joint in the room is the equivalent of smoking. But smoking in the room would need smoke and/or lighting something. Yet i never did that. So i have been charged for cannabis possession in my own room. This "having cannabis" in your room penalty is not stated in the fine print and to say possesing cannabis is the same as smoking is a false equivalence. These are tricks and hustles of the trade I guess. But it's not a nice feeling when people lie and steal your money under false pretence and accusation. The manager also never mentioned this charge to me so that we could discuss it, or came to the room to mention any smell of smoke to me, which suggests this is a common hustle they are operating and hoping guests do not challenge it. If they had a probelm why not come to my room at the time to mention it and then you would have evidence of smoke. This never happened. An end in your room is not smoking in your room.

An extra charge of 282USD was then charged to my account 3 days after i left the hotel and the hotel has not told me what this second extra charge was for. 

They also have not returned my 175US deposit for incidentals yet. Although that should be returned one hopes. Nonetheless i had to cancell my credit card due to these rogue transaction.

So overall not only is the hotel poorly maintained and cleaned but they are looking to scalp extra charges onto your credit card which have to then be challenged. Double check your records if you do stay here.

i regret staying here. The price is relatively high because of the location but the standards are pretty low. I should not have tried to go more budget by staying at the Hampton Inn, but I was trying to save a few bucks. Sometimes however you find out that in trying to save yourself a few bucks you actually end up having a much worse overall experience. Lesson learnt.

If it can be avoided I would suggest not choosing this hotel during your trip.
I am hoping this issue will be taken to a higher level as i have also written a complaint to head office.

title: Great Experience
text: Really enjoyed our stay at this hotel.  It was very close to Grand Central Station, so easy to get around places. Room was very clean and nice. Staff was very helpful and extremely friendly. The hotel provided free breakfast each morning which was really nice. I have 0 complaints about this hotel and would definitely stay again!

title: NY,NY
text: Great location for touring NY.    Staff was friendly.    All of motel was clean, rooms, lobby, breakfast area, elevators.   Even a sitting area outside.   Felt safe in area, was quiet.    Breakfast was very good. Parking available

title: Muy buena experiencia
text: Este hotel está genial! Muy buena atención de todo el personal, son muy amables. Limpieza de habitaciones todos los días, el desayuno para ser gratuito está muy bien, además hay agua, café e infusiones gratuitas durante todo el día. La habitación muy amplia y cómoda, la cama también, buen descanso. El personal habla español, que siempre se agradece. Relación calidad precio muy buena. Lo único que al final no nos resultó tan cómodo es la ubicación, porque nos gusta poder ir andando a la mayoría de sitios y nos pillaba un poco retirado, pero de todas formas la estación Grand Central está muy cerquita.

title: Great NYC stay!
text: Hotel staff were amazing. We watched the breakfast and front desk staff KINDLY deal with a seriously deranged guest shouting at them, and they were so professional, despite all the crazy being thrown at them. The breakfast was great- everything you could want from a free hotel breakfast! The dining area was kept clean and well-stocked, with coffee and tea available all day and night. The rooms are seriously small, as they are in NYC. Basically enough room for the bed, a bathroom hidden behind a pocket door, and a desk/tv combo. Pack light and you’ll be good to go! The hotel is located in a great area! Really close to the UN, 99 cent pizza up the street, and walking distance to Grand Central Station!

title: Quick Business trip
text:
I came for business travel for one night. Ended up checking out and back in for a second night. 
Victoria was at the front desk and she was what made this a 5 Star experience.  Wonderful demeanor and energy!!!   Absolutely understood what great customer service is about. 
She placed me in a great room with a balcony and was fully responsive to one minor issue with the door. 
Otherwise, it was very reasonably priced for the location and pretty standard Hampton Inn (city version) quality. Clean. Comfortable. Convenient location. Lots of restaurants. Didn’t try the breakfast this time.

title: Positive stay in every way, especially staff.
text: This was the best experience I've had at a Hampton hotel. Asia checked us in and was very friendly and professional. She gave us great assistance with our travel questions. The room was clean, cozy, and even quiet! I slept like a baby. On a busy Memorial Day weekend, I was very impressed with all of the staff who kept breakfast stocked, hot, and clean. They were hopping busy, and they kept it going. Kudos to this group of people who really made our weekend smooth and easy. Thank you!

title: Nice, Clean, Small
text: Nice staff and clean room.  Rooms are small, like many NYC hotel rooms, but manageable.  They have free breakfast in the AM and hot coffee/tea all day.  We went for Broadway shows and it's a decent walk to the Times Square/Broadway area, but we knew that going in.

title: Visite de New York
text:
L'hotel Hampton Grand Central est très bien situé dans un quartier calme à proximité de Grand Central qui permet beaucoup de visites à pied. Le métro est à 10 mn à pied.
L'hotel est calme, la chambre n'est pas très grande mais très propre et confortable.
Le petit déjeuner est complet, très bon.
Le personnel est accueillant.

title: Convenient location with wonderful staff.
text: Typical, clean Hampton Inn room - though smaller than usual - New York size.  Reasonable breakfast.  Quick elevators.  Helpful staff - especially Victoria - she really makes you feel welcome and appreciated.  Convenient location with places to dine and shop as well as Times Square theatres.

title: Good experience bad check out
text: Location was pretty good. One tube to anywhere you need to be. Central to some stores such as cvs. Staff were really nice all week, Veronica on the reception was always super friendly. Was a great week away. It was ruined to having a bill at the airport 2/3 hours after check out, claiming that there was smoking happening in the room. Billed for 288 dollars which was declined to get another for 100 dollars. I called them and questioned the charges and to clarify that we hadn’t smoked in the room. Whoever had answered went to clarify with a cleaner for the room to confirm it which was absolutely ridiculous as we had left the room each time and was barely in the hotel unless we were resting from a full day out. I called customer services but I believe the phone went dead and hadn’t had an email back avoid the incident. Not really the best way to leave a nice holiday. I wouldn’t have made a fuss, but I’m not having someone lie to get a nice fee from us.

title: Trip of a lifetime
text: The hotel and its staff helped make this a holiday to remember. From checking in to check out the staff were so friendly and willing to assist with good advice. The rooms were pristine clean and coffe available all day. There was good variety at breakfast each morning.

title: Great value accommodation
text: We chose to celebrate my 50th birthday in New York. This accommodation is perfectly placed 4 minutes walk from Grand Central station with links to the subway. The hotel room was clean, great shower and comfortable bed. Recommend staying in a high floor to reduce the street noise at night. The breakfast is suitable but the plastic cutlery makes eating really frustrating.

title: Great option in Midtown
text: Great place to stay in Midtown. Customer service was wonderful and the breakfast was an added bonus.  Our only issues were that the A/C kept shutting off throughout the night, the pillows were also quite soft and the coffee maker did not work. That said we didn't complain about anything as it was all minor. The vicinity to Grand Central Station was perfect to get all over the city.

title: Great service
text: The warm welcome from Asia at the front desk made up for the small room. Everyone at the front desk, Victoria and all others were friendly and helpful. Good location, plentiful breakfast, tho’ not a lot of healthy options. The front desk made our stay. Thank you!

title: If you want to seriously lose, try to check in!
text: When i checked in, they asked me to prepay 300 usd which will be returned to me after checkout, but they never gave me back those money. While calling the hotel they said it it booking problem not their problem. However with all my attempts i never get those money back. Plus, while living i forgot my phone charger in the room and when i returned and requested, they said it was nothing left in my room. So it was a completely’lost’ on my side.

title: Hampton Inn Review
text:
I was in New York City for the NYC Half Marathon which is the largest half marathon in the United States and wanted a hotel close to the subway system. The hotel is about 1 1/2 blocks from the Grand Central Terminal station. In fact, I discovered a "secret" entrance the subway via a corridor that goes near the Hyatt Centric hotel and exits almost directly onto 43rd street. Grand Central Terminal has access to almost all the subway lines in NYC and Metro North and LIRR.

On the hotel, as a a Hilton Diamond member, I selected my room ahead of item via the Hilton Honors app and made a special request to Ms. Briana Smith ahead of time which was graciously accommodated. Although the hotel was full so I could not check in early, my luggage was stored for the day. Lobby and dining room are small but it never felt crowded as I went to breakfast late. Hotel has NYC size business center and fitness center in the basement but it has everything you need. The complimentary breakfast had eggs, sausage, 3 types of cereal, make your own waffles with 2 flavor, bagels, bread, fruit, hash browns, yogurt, and 3 types of juice and coffee and tea. A pretty good size breakfast with 3 hot items.

I had a king size bedroom on the 21st floor with a view towards other apartment buildings. Bathroom was shower only and bed took most of the room but this is New York City so I was not expecting much. There was a small closet, ironing board, in room safe, desk, and LED TV.

Overall, I would stay at this hotel again due to the convenient location, excellent breakfast, and excellent service from the hotel manager, Ms Briana Smith, and the front desk agents, Tatiana.

title: Great location!
text: So close to Grand Central!  Perfect getting to the subway or train for moving about the City.  Friendly staff, clean room, great price.  Easily walk to theaters, Times Square, UN from here.  Rental car location nearby as well

title: Excellent hospitality
text:
I invite everyone to witness the overall great services of Hampton Inn Manhattan Grand Central, specially visitors to the UN head quarters.
Near the NewYork Grand Central Station, 20 minutes for all most visited areas, Times Square, Empire State Bldg, Macy’s grand stores….

title: Nice economical Stay
text:
About a eight minute walk from Grand Central. 
Check in was seamless through the Hilton app.   Never had to wait more than a minute for an elevator.  Room was clean, although kind of barebones.  Bed seemed a bit on the hard side.  Being on 43rd street, which is not a major thoroughfare, it was fairly quiet. No refrigerator.

title: Great Service - not as great a room
text: My one night stay started out well with a very friendly check-in, HHonors elite status recognition including two bottles of water, and being quickly switched to a vacant room when my originally assigned room was not yet ready. Since the check-in did not mention a way to use the food and beverage credit, I assumed it was because of the free breakfast on offer (which I didn't sample). Getting to the room, my first reaction was "meh" - the TV was small and on a relatively low chest of drawers with a wonky remote. More importantly, the bed was "relatively" hard and I woke up with an achy back. Surprisingly, there was a walk-in shower in the bathroom. With the great quiet neighborhood and being near both the UN and Grand Central - combined with the great service - I would definitely consider staying here again if/when the beds and TV's are renovated

title: I would certainly return
text: I was happy.  The rooms are typically small for New York City.   Shower was nice and hot.  Coffeemaker, but no fridge or microwave.  Was on the 16th floor and the noise from outside was minimal.  Could not hear other rooms.  Good blackout drapes.  Furniture a bit worn, but not horrible.  Pillows a bit flat.  Not worth city view upcharge as all the buildings around it are even taller.

title: Hampton Inn Grand Central New York NY was perfect
text: I had a wonderful stay over three nights.  I arrived early for check in (approximately 10:30AM on a Saturday) and the manager was gracious and able to get me into a room on the 12th floor.  NYC is loud but the higher up the quieter it is; noise level was fine with ear plugs to blend out the occasional siren or trunk.  The free breakfast and WIFI was more than adequate.  There are litterally hundreds of places to eat in walking distance.  Grand Central Station is a couple block walk so you can easily travel from/to anywhere.   The room was basic but very clean with a comfortable bed.  I will stay here again

title: Great location and kind staff
text: We came in a lot earlier bf checkin and we were going to leave our bags while we explored, but Ree was kind enough to check us in early which is so helpful when traveling with my teenager son.  The room was clean and roomy with great view.  Honestly, having stayed at NY hotels in the past you can’t expect much.  You are lucky if you have room to walk around and have a view in the shoe box rooms, so I was pleasantly surprised at how great a room we got and location wise you can’t beat midtown grand central…removed from time square tourism but close enough to walk.

title: Second Worst Hampton Ever
text: I must qualify. I am a Diamond Member and average 80 nights per year at Hilton properties so I know my way around.  This place is a disaster. It is dark, dirty and dingy and in need of a major renovation.  The lobby and room was tiny and claustrophobic.  It is a 21 story hotel and one of two elevators was out all weekend when the hotel was booked. I asked for and did not receive housekeeping service.  The molding in my room fell off.  See photo. The tv was a tiny analog tv. I felt like I was watching the Flintstones on my 12 inch black and white tv in 1969.  Avoid this place at all I mean all costs!

title: Terrific!!
text: The staff was wonderful!! Especially Ajai, she was so nice! Very friendly, professional and gave great customer service! The location was really, really good, right by the Chrysler Building and Grand Central Station. Within easy walking distance to Rockefeller Center, the MOMA, theatre district and more. A great stay!

title: Small Rooms, Staff Not Helpful, Room Was Very Noisy
text: I had a stay here, and found the rooms to be incredibly small (even for NYC standards) and the staff was not very helpful or friendly.  I was also placed right next to the elevators and ice machine, and it was incredibly noisy and difficult to sleep.  I found the room to be very poorly soundproofed and I could literally hear the conversation in the room next door.  I couldn't sleep due to the noise made by other guests as well as the elevator and ice machine.....

title: Bien ubicado pero algo antiguo
text: Estuvimos en Diciembre 2022. Excelente ubicacion, cerca de la gran central, permite moverse con diversos medios de transportes, incluso al lado hay una rentadora de autos las 24 horas. Tambien hay muchas opciones de comida cerca del hotel, mercados o fast food. El hotel es pequeños, las habitacions son pequeñas y tienen poco espacio (pero todo manhatan es asi). El hotel esta desactualizado, antiguo y con mobiliario en mal estado, pero todo funcionaba en nuestra habitacion (agua, luces, etc.). Ofrecen un desayuno bastante amplio incluido en el precio. Volveria a hospedarme aqui principalmente por su excelente ubicacion. Solo me parececio mal que pedi pagar por adelantado la estadia, y luego del checkout me cobraron un adicional porque dijeron que no habian podido cobrar todo!!!!

title: Excellent Pace to Stay Mid Town
text: This hotel is a gem.  The rooms are up to date and super comfortable.   Nice hot breakfast in the morning and super friendly people - all the staff were amazing.  Very close to Grand Central, Public Library, and easy subway access.   Nice fitness room and clean bathrooms.

title: GC Hampton Inn a wonderful find!
text:
I would go back to this NYC hotel in a heart beat! The rooms are small but immaculate. So was the breakfast area!
Probably the cleanest NYC hotel we’ve stayed at. All the employees were friendly and Alejandro at the welcome desk was extremely conscientious. He was able to get our two parties into our rooms early. He also helped us with restaurant recs. He was exceptionally professional and into serving us —I hope he goes far.

title: Shout out to Kaina / Staff for lookin out me and my Family,  from Missouri Family..
text: This place is OUTSTANDING, some of the most courteous, polite staff I’ve ever met. Front Staff:No matter the subject they were able to point you in the right direction, from good eats, and subway routes, to setting up our rides to airport. Room Staff: Courteous with personal items, clean beds and towels all with a Smile. Breakfast Staff: Good food, clean areas and bend over backwards to help out. Sorry if I left anyone out.. ALL 100% so helpful!!! 10/10

title: Great service, Kaina & Pedro are the best!!!
text:
It was a pleasure stayed at the Hampton Inn Manhattan Grand Central location. Kaina at front desk is the best. Professional, welcoming and friendly. Pedro was very pleasant helping  us with our luggage went we arrived even was not his job. 
The room was clean and well maintenance. Thank you to Kaina the FD supervisor, Pedro the engineer for the great stay!

title: Great Hospitality
text: I was pleased with the level of customer service. All of the staff seemed to focus on making sure we had a great weekend.  Kaina went above and beyond what I might have expected. Always pleasant and helpful.

title: Nice hotel
text:
Staff lovely. Hotel a bit dated but overall clean. Reasonable breakfast options.
Some toiletries not in the room but given when requested. Coffee not replenished. Water in one room not in other.small niggles overall good.

title: Très moyen
text:
L’hotel est très moyen …. Les lits sont confortables et la chambre est propre . En revanche, pas d’intimité au niveau des sanitaires… une simple porte coulissante qui ne couvre pas toute la porte !!! 
Au niveau petit déjeuner des couverts en plastique et assiettes en carton ….  La nourriture de qualité moyenne très peu de fruits,…. Je ne retournerai pas dans cet hôtel lors d’un prochain séjour !

title: For a weekend, this place is OK
text: Convenient to Grand Central Terminal and the typically  small room for NYC.  Quiet neighborhood so sleeping was not a problem.  You get what you pay for with breakfast- its free and the experience was not great- no fruit.  The room where one eats needs some serious updating- worn furniture.  As an Honors member, I used points and would not have stayed there if I did not have points to pay for the room.  Rooms are clean.  Staff friendly and attentive.

title: Excellent Service
text: Rooms are small but that’s Manhattan! The rooms are dated in terms of furnishings and design but the staff do a great job keeping the rooms clean. Helped by Joey at the front desk for a super friendly check in and welcome. Manager also helped me with a separate issue and I’m thankful for his flexibility. Rooms ending in 1 and 8 are tucked away in the corners away from the elevator.

title: Friendly staff, comfortable rooms and great location
text: The hotel staff were so friendly, helpful and attentive. The rooms were very clean and comfortable, with the hotel being in a great location to explore the city. Basic breakfast is included as well as Wi-Fi. However, it was expensive for a Hampton Inn (although it is New York!).

title: Hotel & Service Review
text: I stayed two nights this week and the hotel staff was great. Kaina was very helpful.  Her service level was comparable to concierge service at a 5 star hotel.  The hotel has a small common but the rooms and service were all on point. Service to the room by staff was helpful.  Cleanliness of the rooms each day was excellent. I would stay here again given the service provided.

title: Great property
text: Stayed here with a family in October 2022. The room size is generous by Manhattan standards, and we were able to see the Chrysler Building from our window. The room and the hotel in general are clean and well-maintained. The reception staff was friendly and courteous, quickly resolving a few minor issues for us. The breakfast variety is good, although it may be a bit crowded a little later in the morning. The elevators are fast, although sometimes you may have to wait a bit for them to arrive. The location is great for your general NYC tourist destinations. Nothing negative to say about this place, if the price is right, you are not likely to regret your choice.

title: Heart in New York
text: We stayed recently for 3 nights at this very central location and was very impressed especially from the reception staff. Rashree was fantastic!  Thank you for your service.  The only negative for us was that some of the bedroom and breakfast area furniture was tired and worn.

title: Smoking fee was charged even though I am a non smoker
text: I never smoke.  I always request a nonsmoking room.  But I was charged a smoking fee of $250.  I got the receipt via email.  Will dispute with my credit card about the charge.  Avoid this hotel if you don’t want any billing problem.

title: HOTEL CATENA HILTON IN POSIZIONE FANTASTICA!
text: Ho soggiornato in questo fantastico hotel con mio marito e mio figlio dal 6 agosto all' 11 agosto 2022, e ci siamo trovati molto bene. La camera non era grandissima era comunque confortevole, con due letti matrimoniali alla francese, la scrivania con sedia, un piccolo armadio con dentro anche asse da stiro e ferro, e nella scrivania c'era il bollitore per thè e caffè (apprezzo sempre quando lo trovo in camera!). Il bagno era piccolo ma essenziale e molto pulito e rifornito di tutti i prodotti da bagno, apprezzo molto anche questo. Alla reception ho trovato dei ragazzi gentili, nonostante il mio scarso inglese, cercavano di aiutarmi a capire quando chiedevo indicazioni sulle attrazioni da visitare o le fermate della metropolitana da prendere. Sono stati tutti molto gentili e rispettosi. La colazione era abbondante e varia, ovviamente tutta americana con uova, bacon, waffle, salsiccie, e tanto altro per il salato, e per il dolce c'erano i MUFFIN (che adoro e mangiavo tutte le mattine ed erano sempre diversi, alla frutta o alla cannella o al cioccolato!) varie marmellate, burro e miele e due/tre tipi di pane per farcirli con queste prelibatezze. C'erano anche yogurt, ovviamente i fiocchi d'avena, le macchinette per caffè caldo e acqua calda per il the', e in sala colazioni erano disponibili anche due contenitori di latte, uno normale e uno alla mandorla. Insomma, una favola americana meravigliosa! Ho adorato i due tavolini con ombrelloni fuori nel cortiletto  dell'hotel, dove tutte le sere cenavamo con il nostro cibo d'asporto (New York non è Bologna, è tutto molto caro! Quindi, consiglio di comprare qualcosa nei fast food, e portarselo in hotel o farselo portare ...ho scoperto l'applicazione UBER EATS dove puoi ordinare il cibo che vuoi e te lo consegnano all'entrata dell'hotel! Paghi la consegna ovviamente, ma è fantastico e comunque meno caro che mangiare nei ristoranti di midtwon!). La zona dove è ubicato l'hotel è perfetta, quasi di fronte al CHRYSLER, e vederlo al tramonto è una sensazione di pura meraviglia che ti fa battere il cuore. L'hotel è vicino alla GRAND CENTRAL STATION, dove c'è un delizioso mercato e localini per mangiare a pranzo, che è la stazione centrale e grandissima dei treni, e ovviamente si trova anche la metropolitana. Io mi sono innamorata di NEW YORK, e ho ancora tante cose belle da vedere e tanti sorrisi ancora da dare e da ricevere, ho intenzione di tornare, mi sono data tempo massimo due anni, per i miei 50 anni, vorrei rivivere LA FAVOLA AMERICANA, e per una scrittrice e creativa come me, a NEW YORK, TUTTO E' ANCORA POSSIBILE! Consiglio di cuore di soggiornare in questo fantastico hotel.

title: Séjour du 23 au 28 août
text:
Hôtel très bien situé à Manhattan, à proximité de la grande gare centrale. 
Chambre confortable, très bonne literie. 
Bon juste un peu vieux le mobilier surtout les canapés en salle de petit déjeuner. 
Le personnelles très Pro, agréable, souriant et au petit soin. 
Un très grand merci à Ree pour sa gentillesse. 
Pour conclure si on doit revenir à new York, on choisira à coup sûr cet hôtel

La famille Le Garec

title: First time in New York
text: I found this place from Booking.com. The Hotel was in a good, peaceful spot, just a few blocks away from Grand Central Terminal. Walking distance short to Central Park and Time Square too. Felt like a really safeful place to be. Staff were helpfull. Fantastic place for the first time in New York. Next time in New York, this is surely the Hotel i am going to book again.

title: Buona soluzione a due passi dalla stazione
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato 5 notti in questo hotel appartenente alla catena Hilton. La posizione è ottima, a due passi da Grand Central Station e il personale è molto gentile e disponibile. Abbiamo apprezzato che fossero sempre disponibili bevande calde, acqua e microonde a qualsiasi ora del giorno. Colazione ben fornita, dolce e salata.
Per quanto riguarda le camere, confortevoli ma molto datate: l’arredamento è vecchio, la moquette avrebbe bisogno di un bel rinnovo  e i letti sono alla francese, non matrimoniali. La camera non è molto spaziosa e la nostra era molto buia, poche luci a disposizione e molto deboli. 
Abbiamo letto recensioni in cui si diceva che la pulizia era assente; da noi sono passati tutti i giorni a pulire e a cambiare le salviette.
Nel complesso, lo consigliamo per chi non ha grosse pretese e desidera un hotel di appoggio per visitare la città.

title: Honest Review
text:
The front desk staff had impeccable customer service, were kind, professional, and thoughtful. Me and my wife experienced NYC during a heat wave and Asia at the front desk was always quick to offer refreshments and ask how Hampton Inn could make our stay better.

Unfortunately, the internet Wi-Fi in this building is somewhat notorious for always being down (LTE had to be used throughout the entire stay). The rooms are very small (which is to be expected in NYC) and the King Sized beds are actually a bit smaller when compared to other Hilton hotels offer (felt more like a Queen). 

On top of that, the hallways in the building are rather warm during the summer (there may be a ventilation issue in this property) but on the UPSIDE the hotel is in a great location. 

We were within walking distance to many tourist sites and even had a clear view of the Chysler Building. 

For the right price I would stay here again, just hoping the higher ups see this review and renovate a site that has wonderful, deserving staff and great location!

title: Awesome desk and housekeeping staff
text: Ree at the front desk always has a smile and positive attitude at check in. Crynthia in housekeeping is also friendly and helpful. Great people that clearly enjoy their job - My favorite desk and housekeeping staff!

title: Bellissimo hotel
text:
Hotel situato al centro di New York, nella zone di Time square. Acca to alla metro. 
Hotel pulito, a pochi passi da tutto. Colazione variegata e abbondante. Personale qualificato e pronto ad ogni tua esigenza. Camere pulite e asciugami  che vengono cambiati ogni giorno. Non si sentono rumori da fuori.
La consiglio.

title: Exceptional Service with clean rooms
text:
I stay in a lot of Hilton properties (diamond member) and came to this Hampton Inn because it was close to where I needed to stay and was a reasonable price for a room. A few notes up front - parking in ANY hotel in NYC is going to cost - the price for this was $50 per day with no ability to go in and out - you park and that's it. Know that going in and you should be fine. 

The rooms, as is typical of any hotel (within a reasonable budget) are smallish - I had a King bed room which was fine for the 1 night. The breakfast is standard Hampton Inn food. What set this apart from my many other visits was the exceptional customer service provided by the two people at the front desk - Callina and Alejandro (spelling on the names?). As soon as I walked in I felt like part of the family. They were both efficient and caring, took time to chat but also got us through the process (I had actually done self-check in but needed to ask a question). There was a small issue with the reservation which they both worked through with me to my benefit. It made the night so much easier to deal with. This is a very strong recommend from someone with way too much experience staying at hotels.

title: Il volto accogliente di New York
text: Abbiamo soggiornato in questo hotel per quattro notti. L'accoglienza è stata veramente eccezionale: tante attenzioni per il cliente, a cominciare dal caffè e acqua nella lobby sempre presenti, possibilità di riempire le borracce, colazione da portar via in caso di partenze a orari complicati. Tutto il personale (un saluto speciale a Kaina!) ha fatto veramente il massimo per noi, con infinita gentilezza e simpatia. La posizione eccezionale a due passi da Grand Central e anche dalla navetta per l'aeroporto di Newark. Consigliatissimo!

title: Très bon rapport qualité/prix
text:
Hôtel très bien placé près de grand central ,de central park ..
 très propre et très bonne literie.
Petit déjeuner varié sous forme de buffet 
Mériterait un rajeunissement au niveau du mobilier et un frigo dans la chambre.

title: Great Spot
text: Even though the hotel is on the east side between third and second ave. It’s very quiet. Great staff. Breakfast will be crowded and busy so get downstairs early. Great front desk staff. Nice size room for a single or couple.

title: Great stay at Hampton Inn Grand Cantral
text:
We had stayed 10 years ago at this hotel with our 2 young children and so decided to come back to this hotel as we had a great stay then.
We stayed 5 nights in July at the Hampton Inn with our two now teenage children, one room with 2 double beds, comfortable room and breakfast was included which was great. Good choice at breakfast and the staff was replenishing and always helpful when something was needed. Asia and Kaina were great at the front desk.
The only thing I would say is that the furniture in the breakfast room is due an update apart from that everything was perfect and we hope to come and stay again!

title: Rashree
text: We had a very nice time in NYC. Thank you to your staff, everyone were super nice, great service. Special thanks to Rashree. She was a very professional, helpful, nice. We had a chance to leave our luggage, that was very very helpful.

title: Vorrei ma non posso
text:
Partiamo dai lati positivi.
Sicuramente le ragazze della reception.
Sempre cordiali, gentili, disponibili.
La posizione, ottima. Grand Central Station a 300 mt e le principali linee della metro. Ma quei sacchi di spazzatura a pochi metri dall'entrata non ci dovrebbero essere.
Il prezzo, competitivo.
Basterebbe questo per essere contenti.
Però sei a New York.
Ed allora ti aspetti qualcosa in più.
L'albergo è piccolo per i parametri della città.
Non ha vista.
Le camere sono vecchie. Piccole. Datate. La moquette non ce la fà più.
La pulizia (se richiesta) viene fatta giornalmente) ma in modo molto superficiale.
Il bagno angusto. Senza finestra.
La colazione è compresa.
Sarebbe un plus.
Però, c'è un però. La scelta è piuttosto limitata e la qualità lascia a desiderare.
La sala colazione si sdoppia.
In una parte la temperatura è eccessivamente bassa, nell'altra si boccheggia.
In conclusione, albergo per chi, una volta varcata la soglia, si dimentica di essere a NY ma necessità solo di un posto dove farsi una doccia e dormire.

title: Old building friendly front desk
text: We were greeted with some of the nicest people we have met on our New England road trip hitting all of the major cities. Kaina was an absolute gem. She was so friendly and took the time to listen and explain things. Parking was not as bad as we thought it would be considering the poor Google reviews. The rooms themselves were clean but run-down. The bathroom door is heavy and did not lock. Elevators were not a problem. Free water bottles at front desk was a nice perk. Breakfast was ok not the best and not the worst hotel breakfast. The hotel was convenient to the subway. If you are looking for a fun time, go to Ellen's Stardust diner as it is an easy way to get dinner with a show. Free fun was the Staten Island ferry. Both were a highlight of our trip.

title: Great Service and Stay!
text: Kaina was honestly great, her customer service was impeccable and she was super helpful. The rooms were ok and the location was great. There was a 99 cent pizza shop right down the street, it’s about a 5 min walk to grand central so the subway was super close. Very convenient and nice hotel to stay at!

title: Kaina
text: Kaina attended our group very quickly and called to make sure our rooms were clean and inspected. Helped us with a room keycard  issue and even offered us complimentary breakfast!! She’s amazing thank you Kaina! 😍

title: Above and Beyond
text:
I was told that New York hotels that are around the same star rating are all the same, but I've had the pleasure of being convinced otherwise. Every front desk staff worker was exceptional, even from the scheduling process, including Karina, Joey, Rashree, and more.

Breakfast exceeded my expectations and I'm forced to be a picky eater due to food allergies. To come back every day to a hotel staff that engaged with us constantly and made us feel comfortable here is a very special and rare thing.

Not to mention the free water during a very hot and humid stay in New York. I am very impressed with the people who hired this above and beyond hotel staff.

title: Review
text: Very pleasant experience visiting at the hotel. The hotel was very clean. Staff were very nice and friendly, especially Rashree was very amiable and helpful (to find the locations we wanted to visit), huge thumbs up 👍! Will come back!

title: Awesome staff and great hotel on best position!
text: hotel, staff is amazing, especially Ms. Asia, she is great and really helpfully lady. Hotel is at great location only few minutes walk from Grand Central Station. As  New York first timers we looked for safe and best possible location to see the city, Hampton Inn Grad Central delivered all that we needed. Special bonus goes to their great service and their taking care of their guests.... they offer to guest free bottled water so you can refresh between sightseeing.... My 5* goes to them... Until next time

title: Super Staff Members
text: I thoroughly and completely enjoyed my stay at this Hampton inn hotel. A massive shout out to the supervisor Kaina for her amazing customer service skills. Thank you Kaina for your friendly attitude towards your guests, your willingness to help resolve any issue, your listening skill and your energetic demeanor. I can't believe you remembered my name the next day and greeted me immediately you saw me coming back to the hotel. It was a beautiful for me so thank you for that. A huge thank you to Alex for always being immediately ready to help out the guest. Wonderful service here at the hotel and great staff members.

title: Locatie locatie locatie
text: Locatie locatie locatie. Deze iets gedateerde hampton Inn heeft voor hampton Inn begrippen kleine kamers, maar is wel schoon en netjes. Het ontbijt is wat magertjes, ontbijtruimte is wat klein voor de vele kamers. De liften zijn ontzettend langzaam, maar alles wat iets minder is wordt goed gemaakt door de perfecte locatie van dit hotel. Midden in het hart van Manhattan. Wij zouden zeker terugkomen!

title: Average, but great location.
text:
Great location, brilliant base for exploring New York. There were three of us in one room and we had two double beds. The room was a good size for New York. 

However, the rooms are tired and the nets were old and grey, carpets old, bed coverings worn, but it was clean. 

Service at the desk was patchy in terms of some staff being really friendly or making you feel like you were being a pain eg. by asking for a clean towel. One staff member was really rude to someone in front of me in the queue over a hold on his card that he didn’t understand. Not great. 

You get free water, we only found out because we saw someone ask at the desk - we were not told. 

There is coffee and tea available all day. It’s only coffee in your rooms. Breakfast is not great but if that’s all you want is coffee, fruit, pastry and a yogurt or something it’s ok. The hot food was rank. 
You eat off a paper plate with plastic knives and forks.

The breakfast staff were lovely. A big issue for me was the volume of breakfast plates, knives and forks thrown in the trash. In 2022 I’d expect this chain to do more for the environment! Awful.

title: Great value and location in Manhattan
text: Just spent four nights at the Hampton Grand Central with my teenage daughter. Staff was very friendly. The two double beds were perfect for us and very comfortable. Location is ideal for exploring New York City. Neighborhood is quiet and safe. Five minute walk to Grand Central Station. Breakfast was decent each morning. Hilton Honors WIFI worked fine. Only minor complaint was the walls were rather thin and we could clearly hear conversations in adjacent room. If you want a mini-fridge in your room, it's an extra fee per day but worth it.

title: Don’t waste your money
text: The staff was horrible and the maid service was even worse.  The maid came and left towels and didn’t take any of the trash.  The staff promised to move me to a double room and then didn’t put one aside.  They were super snotty when I talked to them about it.

title: Jewel in the Crown of New York City
text:
Fantastic value and location. Extremely helpful and friendly staff.
Room had two double beds and was extremely comfortable after long tiring days.
Different breakfast every day set us up until Dinner time.
I'm so glad I read the reviews and found that the whole package was extremely good value for money and hope to visit again. Thank you!

title: Super location in Manhattan
text: I looked long and hard to find an affordable East Side hotel that included breakfast.  This was it, super breakfast, great location for finding reasonable restaurants in walking distance; quiet with only 8 rooms per floor; pleasant, hard working staff.  Others have noted, as well, that the furniture in the lobby, breakfast area, and the rooms are totally beat up.  The time to replace them is long overdue.  Bedding was fine, as was the bathroom.

title: Très proches du métro et de la gare
text:
Hôtel à deux minutes à pied de la gran central. Il est très bien situé. 
Hôtel propre ainsi que le restaurant. 
Le petit dej est inclus dans le tarif cependant il n’est pas très varié. Il y a très peu de choix. 

Je recommande cet hôtel si vous voulez faire beaucoup de chose à pied.

title: Mediocre
text: Basic hotel with great location to Gand Central, but expensive for what it is.  Rooms are tiny but clean. Lobby is tiny and cramped. Service is questionable - asked for extra pillows that never arrived, had to wait over 15 minutes in lobby before a person came to help us even though the security guard was just sitting there playing on his phone and another off duty staff person kept walking behind the desk while ignoring us. Breakfast was a shitshow - super crowded, freezing cold room, and disgusting seating (a worn out couch that was so low my chin barely reached the table - and I’m 6’1”). It served its purpose but…ick.

title: Perfect for our needs
text: The hotel room was small but clean. The shower was hot and the location was premium to be able to jump on the subway and get anywhere you wanted to go. The staff were really friendly and the breakfast was great.

title: HOTEL ECONOMICO CERCA DE GRAND CENTRAL
text: Muy buena atención en recepción. Habitación y baño muy pequeños, muebles ya muy usados. Se escuchan los ruidos de las habitaciones contiguas. Zona conveniente de día, pero de noche se sentía insegura. Desayuno incluído que no probamos porque salimos temprano al aeropuerto. Es un hotel económico a 5 minutos caminando de la Grand Central.

title: Lovely folks can't make up for this total dump
text: The staff are lovely but this hotel is not just shabby, it's a dump. The couch in the lobby and the chair in my room look like they had been pulled from a garbage bin. Ditto for the breakfast room. The walls are so thin, you can hear your neighbours burp. The wifi does not work at all.  I don't normally write reviews but I wish someone had warned me about this place before I booked it. I've stayed in some sketchy hotels in NYC, but this was a new low. Close this one down Hampton Inn - it needs a gut job.

title: Great location , Shabby facilities
text: The only really good thing about this hotel is the location, just up the road from grand central making it easy to get to all the main sites. As long as your intending not to spend too much time in your hotel room this place is fine. It has hot water and the rooms are clean, although in 4 days they only came once to make up the room and change towels, even though we were out all day every day!! We had two rooms and both had interconnecting doorways to other rooms, you can basically hear everything that goes on next door, including when the couple next door decided to have some noisy ‘fun’ 2 nights running! The breakfast is disgusting, we took one look and decided against it, the room you have breakfast in is shabby to say the least and the rubber omelettes and fat dripping bacon look like they would give you more problems. Don’t fear though there are plenty of good breakfast places nearby. If I come to NY again I will not be staying here unless the hotel has a much needed refit!

title: Wrongly charged for cancellation and no refund provided
text:
I am a very loyal Hampton and Hilton customer, but I am minded never to stay at one of their hotels again after my recent experience with being wrongly charged for cancellation and then not being able to secure a refund. 

I had to cancel a stay at this hotel recently due to a last-minute family emergency. I booked my stay on a no-cancellation fee condition and the circumstances meant I had to cancel just a few hours before the time window for free cancellation expired. 

However, an issue that arose with Expedia’s website (which they acknowledged) meant that my request for cancellation was not processed by the company correctly and I had to try again the next day - at which point I was charged a cancellation fee because it was no longer within the time window. This is despite me initially requesting the cancellation within the time window. 

I contacted Expedia, who contacted the hotel and all agreed that the cost of cancellation would be waived on this occasion. However, to my disappointment, the cost of a night’s stay was still withdrawn from my account as a cancellation fee. I have tried contacting Expedia, who insist they can’t handle the refund as this is Hampton’s responsibility, but I contacted Hampton and they insisted that the refund is actually Expedia’s responsibility. I am at a loss for words and I am quickly losing my patience. Maybe next time I will take my business to another hotel chain.

title: God beliggenhed - dårlig indkvartering
text: Hotellets beliggenhed er fantastisk med let og enkel adgang til Grand Central, hvorfra man kan tage Subwayen rundt på Manhattan. Desuden ligger der i nærheden mange steder hvor man hurtigt kan få fat på noget mad - både dyre restauranter og 99 cent-pizza. Indkvarteringen på hotellet var dog ikke prangende på nogen måde. Vi boede fire på samme værelse og pladsen var meget begrænset og så var badeværelset under 2 meter fra den nærmeste seng kun adskilt af en for lille skydedør, der gjorde følelsen af privatliv under toiletbesøg meget lille. Desuden var morgenmaden virkelig ringe, men man forventer nok heller ikke mere i USA.

title: Helpful when things went wrong....
text: I was visiting from the west coast with our scout troop, On the last day, my daughter got very sick and unable to travel. I was exhausted from taking care of her. Alejandro at the front desk was so compassionate. He arranged for us to stay longer and not have to change rooms. Alex helped me in the middle of the night when I needed to remove my stuff from our other room. The next day, they supplied me with bland foods for her in spite of being well  past breakfast. Nobody wants to be I'll far from home, but they helped us make the best of a bad situation.

title: INSTALAÇÕES ANTIGAS E ATENDIMENTO PÉSSIMO
text: Ficamos hospedados por 3 dias neste hotel. A localização não é ruim, ainda que não seja das melhores. As instalações são antigas e o quarto é de tamanho razoável. Limpeza no estilo americano. O café da manhã está OK, então até aí não temos nada que desabone muito o hotel. O problema é que esta rede agora inventou que não faz mais o serviço de arrumação de quartos, somente mediante pedido pois "respeitam a privacidade do cliente". Venhamos e convenhamos, se o cliente quiser tanta privacidade assim, não vai para um hotel, aluga um apartamento! Só que mesmo mediante pedido eles se fazem de loucos e não fazem o serviço, que aliás está incluído no preço da diária. No segundo dia limparam o quarto mediante ameaça de pegar o dinheiro de volta e procurar outro hotel. Vergonhoso para uma rede de renome mundial. Lamentável!

title: Great location and functional hotel
text:
We stayed at the Hampton Inn for two nights last week. We absolutely loved the location. Easy walking or catching a train at Grand Central Station. There is a world of amazing food options all around. The breakfast buffet was good and even included a gluten-free bagel. The price of the hotel makes it well worth it. We found it quite clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful. 
Be aware that the rooms are quite small. We didn’t mind because we didn’t come to NYC to stay in the room all day, but with two teenagers and us, the quarters would have been tight had we wanted to hang out in the room more. Even with that, would definitely recommend this hotel for your New York trip!

title: Situation parfaite !!!
text:
Situation géographique parfaite, personnel accueillant et très disponible.
Petit déjeuner variee et inclus dans le prix, ce qui n'est pas négligeable a NY !!!
Chambre propre, hôtel très calme.
A recommander.

title: Gutes Budget Hotel
text: Das Hotel liegt in einer zentralen Lage. Alles nicht weit weg, aber nicht so stressig wie am Times Square. Das Polster der Stühle ist zwar teilweise verschließen und die Zimmer nicht die größten, aber das Frühstück ist ausreichend und es gibt nur freundliches Personal. Und man bekommt 24h Tee oder Kaffee. Perfektes Budget Hotel in zentraler Lage.

title: Lovely trip
text:
Myself and my wife stayed here and my 7 year iols
Son we had a wonderul
Time . Hotel was perfectly located right beside grand central. Hotel room was lovely and clean . Only obstaclr was one lift working but that was not a big deal . Breakfast was lovely . Would go back again when i visit nuc again . Thanks for hospitality

title: Avoid
text: I absolutely do not recommend staying at this hotel. The phone/messaging service is blocked in the hotel. The wifi is unreliable. The lobby is super small and looks trashy with a couch that they seem to have found on the side of the road. Only 1 out of 2 elevators is functional in a buiding with 21 floors. Yes, I had to use the stairs a lot. They do offer breakfast but it's not good and the dining area is extremely small and the chairs look like they found them on the side of the road too. The room furniture and appliances are in need of a lot of repairs and replacements. I stayed 3 nights but they only cleaned the room once.

title: Hampton Inn: comfort, location, and consistency
text:
We stayed at the Hampton Inn Grand Central this past Saturday. It was a wonderful stay, largely because of basic joys (a comfy bed, good options on cable), but more so, the location is amazing. We were a mere five minute walk from Grand Central, as well as a stone’s throw from a bunch of great food options (uh, poke and ramen within given minutes? Yes!). On top of all this, we were given the warmest greeting by the front desk clerk who checked us in. He offered us restaurant suggestions and recommended worthwhile local attractions, and bumped us from a second floor room to one on the ninth floor when I said I hated street noise.
This Hampton Inn was just the right combo of familiar amenities, great location, and friendly employees. Thank you!

title: Hampton/Hilton quality and service in midtown NYC at a value price
text: Snug quiet small hotel in midtown. Not luxury but very comfortable, clean and friendly.  They offer a free breakfast which is easily $50 for two people if you go out in the area. I'd stay here every time I come to NYC if they have room

title: Hampton Manhattan Times Square
text:
This hotel must have a special secret for hiring employees.  They want to help you enjoy your time in NYC any way they can.    Joseph calls himself the “Bellman “ and indeed he does that job well. He is also the greeter and concierge with knowledge of food, directions, theater, shopping and more. The breakfast is yummy with lots of choices and again a delightful staff wanting to help. 
 COVID Protocols are followed so everyone can feel safe. Loved this hotel and staff

title: Avoid
text: Best to avoid.  Poor quality and service. Although a good location I would avoid as much better options. Certainly does not live up to the Hilton brand.  Gives the brand a bad rap.  Very noisy. Look elsewhere if staying in the city

title: Needs work
text: The location is great, but the hotel needs an upgrade. The furniture is old and dirty. They forgot to clean our room our first night there. The staff was nice and gave us advise on what places to visit. The breakfast selection was just okay. They definitely need to consider upgrading that hotel and definitely get new furniture.

title: Maybe it was just the wrong time to be at this hotel
text:
First, one of the elevators was broken. I was told it would be fixed during my stay; it wasn’t. 

Second, I upgraded to the balcony room and the balcony door wouldn’t close. So they downgraded my room but upgraded my price vs what I registered for.

title: Excelente hotel en el centro de Manhattan
text: Buscamos un hotel para pasar un par de días conociendo New York y nos encontramos con este hotel perfectamente ubicado con una atención excelente, los cuartos muy buenos y aseados y en servicio de desayuno excelente. Recomendadisimo

title: Excelente
text:
O hotel é muito bom, bem localizado, perto da Grand Central, fácil acesso a pé.
A região a noite é bem tranquila, não tivemos nenhum tipo de problema saindo a pé. O quarto é bem amplo, bem limpo e bem organizado.

title: Location is good
text: Staff very good and helpful. It is NYC. So size is appropriately small. However we had a nice King size bed. Bathroom and shower were very good. Complimentary breakfast was a plus. Close to Grand Centrsl Subway.

title: Not worth the value
text:
Poor customer service 
Poor cleanliness 
Poor perks
Dated facility not worth the value
Very tight quarters and location
Plumbing issues
Poor lighting 
At the cost of this location, and the name of this hotel, the value is below the expectations. Consider hotels in the boroughs as the cost for parking is excessive compared to other lots around the corner.

title: NYC trip
text: Room was small, but worked for what we needed. Wish we had a fridge and microwave for leftovers, would have saved us money. Breakfast was okay. Eggs were terrible & the waffle was pretty basic. The door to the bathroom was incredibly heavy, felt like lifting 200lbs everytime you tried to slide it open or close. Location was great. Right near grand central, within walking distance of a CVS and Starbucks.

title: Deludente
text:
Posizione centrale e colazione buona e staff cordiale!
Ma per il resto le 4 stelle non le meritano!
Stanze e struttura datata!
Pulizia fatta a giorni alterni!
Ho chiesto un phon e mi è stato consegnato 1 giorno dopo soltanto dopo solleciti!

title: Very convenient, but they didn't clean our room
text:
This was an easy walk from Grand Central Station and many nice restaurants. A little longer walk took us to the Theater District and Times Square.

Breakfast was plentiful, varied, and quite good.

Unfortunately they never told us that they clean rooms only on Monday Wednesday and Friday unless you ask at the desk. When we returned after a busy day of sightseeing our room had not been cleaned and they had no one on duty at that hour.The room was fairly comfortable but noisy.

title: Great hotel
text: The hotel was very clean and quiet.  The staff was helpful and extremely accommodating.  We enjoyed our stay and it was located within close proximity to many sites and attractions.  We would definitely stay there again.

title: Check In Nightmare
text: Canceled my room without me knowing it took forever to get another room been a honors member for 8 years. While the staff there tried to help it was just very frustrating. The manager the next morning never came out to help or even acknowledge the issue I had very unprofessional.

title: Insgesamt in Ordnung
text: Zimmer waren sauber, aber sehr hellhörig und in die Jahre gekommen. Frühstück war zwar kostenlos, aber leider sehr eintönig. Service am Empfang und Zimmer waren gut. Die Lage war sehr gut und wir würden wieder hin, weil es insgesamt in Ordnung war.

title: Hotel
text:
Nice location, dirty. We never got towels or toilet paper sent to our room. 
The toaster for breakfast was broken so we had to wait in line to toast a bagel. Our phone was also broken so we couldn’t contact the front desk

title: Do not stay here
text:
If I could give it less than one star, I would  .
The only thing they did right was the breakfast which, for life in Covid was handled reasonably well. 

Understand that we generally gravitate to Hampton Inns.  They’re predictably clean, spacious, comfortable, and quiet.  Staff tends to be pretty much consistently friendly and helpful.
