This particular one is a franchise and never should have been made a Hampton. It’s rooms are tiny. The walls are paper thin.  Noise is nearly constant.  They booked someone our room at 12:45 am while we were long in bed. When I finally got through to them that we were staying I called the front desk.  Waited for 5 minutes.  They never picked up the phone. 

I did not sleep at all that night, ruining a overnight getaway we’d been planning for months.  

Stay away!

title: Excellent Stay in Midtown
text: We were warmly welcomed by each of the team members during our stay. When we asked for housekeeping items, they were brought to our room within 5 minutes, which was greatly appreciated. Comfortable and clean rooms in a great location for tourists and business people (3 blocks from Grand Central Station)

title: A Little Above Average
text: Hampton Inn was centrally located; close to ATMs, Grand Central Subway and Times Square. Price per night was pretty good.The rooms were basic with clean sheets and towels. Bathroom was remodeled. Air conditioner, furnishings and tv are in need of serious updates. Breakfast was decent.

title: Great location
text: The location for the hotel. Close to everything .hotel room was clean and h try e check in process was smooth. Highly recommend if your in New York City. Great view from the 16th floor. The serve breakfast and there are many food choices walking distance.

title: Good BANG for the BUCK!
text: We are almost always satisfied with Hampton Inn stays no matter where they are located.  It is hard to find reasonably priced lodging in NYC near our daughter's apartment.  This property is excellent across the board.  We will definitely stay here again.

title: Choose another hotel!
text: Rundown, chipped and peeling furniture, mildew odor from the AC unit. Rooms are extremely small, but many are in Manhattan. Don’t expect a “normal” sized Hampton room. The only thing going for this hotel is the convenient location. So choose another hotel in the area! I picked this one without reading reviews because Hilton hotels are generally nice. This one isn’t.

title: Awful
text: This has been one of the worst hotels we ever stayed.  I would have checked out right away if I hadn't prepaid for the room. Our bathroom had not been cleaned by the previous guest, when I said something to the front desk all they said was throw the soap away. The bedding and curtains were stained. The AC didn't work correctly and smelled musty. We paid over 200 a night and feel like I was taken advantage of. The street would have been cleaner and more updated than this place.

title: Horrible experience, don't stay here.
text:
We can't even tell you the quality of our stay because there was nobody working at the front desk to check us in. It was Sunday on an afternoon so there should be no reason for this to be the case. In addition, there were 5+ other people who had been waiting for hours to either check in or had been waiting for their rooms for 3+ hours. One of them informed us that the lady at the front desk had been gone for at least an hour. A hotel should not expect people to be able to wait around for HOURS just to check in, especially when visiting another city on business with plans. So far, there has been no indication the hotel will be giving refunds or any sort of compensation for this absolutely horrible customer service. 

If I could give this hotel zero stars I would. I would not recommend staying here. Don't waste your time and stay somewhere run by people who know how to do their jobs.

title: Main thing going for it is the location
text: Some areas of the hotel are shabby (lobby, breakfast area, some room furniture) and some are fine (beds have good mattresses and linens; pillows are cheap). Bathroom in our room was tiny, shower worked OK but hot water was sporadic and water pressure not great. Carpeting in room was old and that grossed us out.  Breakfast was adequate and nice that it was included with price of room. The location is what this hotel can boast about, if you are looking to be close to Grand Central Station.  Otherwise I recommend to spend a bit more on a hotel that doesn't look like it dragged in furniture from the trash bin to furnish the public areas as well as part of the rooms. Staff is super friendly and helpful and kudos to them for presenting a uniformly positive attitude. They are the best part of this hotel.

title: Eh.
text: Eh. That’s the nicest thing I can say about this hotel. Room had a wet spot on the floor and a musty feel. And it just wasn’t up to the standards of a Hampton Inn. Staff seemed indifferent. The proximity to Grand Central was nice. Eh.

title: A WATE OF MONEY!
text: This has been my first time going to the Hotel In Manhattan and I’m highly disappointed! I will NOT go there again ! Rooms were extremely small, bathrooms were dirty! You can literally hear the people next door!

title: Awesome
text: Clean, great breakfast with a lot of hot and cold options.friendly, close to a number of popular locations. Comfy beds, per hotel policy no maid service everyday but you can ask for it the night before.

title: Hotel branch extremely unhelpful and useless if you have medical problems.
text: Upon entering the hotel room, we noticed it was very musty, even with the a.c on. There is no vent in the bathroom and therefore the room becomes very humid and damp all the time, which can be uncomfortable when you're trying to sleep. The remote was greasy and there was some type of sticky white tape residue on the bottom. The room phone also had some funky crust on the dial pad and it did not work when we tried to call down to the front desk- just got the busy beep, so we had to call the front desk from our cell phone. The room had a coffee maker and coffee packets but no paper cups. This is the first hotel I've stayed in where the comforter and top blanket are combined- mine was stained on the bottom and I noticed one of the pillows had some yellow  stains on the side as well. I stayed here on a business trip with my elderly parents. One of them has a medical condition where they get up tp use the bathroom about 6 times a night. The problem with the room  (other than everything already mentioned) is that the bathroom has a very heavy sliding door, instead of the regular door that opens and closes. One of my parents is very old and could barely open the door and close it that many times and I also had trouble opening it and I'm pretty strong. This made it very stressful for them at night. What is the alternative, to use the bathroom with the door open? - impossible when the bathroom toilet directly faces the beds. The sliding door also doesn't close all the way so there's about an inch and that doesn't leave a lot of privacy, either, which is also very uncomfortable.  I've stayed in hotel rooms in various parts of NYC and this is one of the smallest. We had a 2 night stay. After the first night I tried calling Hampton Inn corporate and expressing the medical concerns of my party and asked their corporate manager to move me to another hotel within their branch and that I'd be happy to pay the difference. The "manager" which was obviously someone from overseas, said that I have to just book another room myself and see that if this hotel will refund me later on.  I chose this very cheap hotel only because it is within a block of a private event at the U.N that we were in attendance of on  both days of our NYC stay and so it was literally the only reason why we stayed. Hampton Inn (Hilton) did not care about my families medical needs in regards the room and offered no help whatsoever. The web doesn't make it clear that this hotel had sliding doors for their bathrooms, so I really wasn't aware of this ahead of time. The woman at the front desk is also very abrupt and unhelpful. I do not recommend staying at this hotel at all. It's one thing to deal with a dirty hotel room, but it's another when they will not even try to accommodate you when there are medical issues involved.

title: Worse NYC Hotel
text: This is the worse hotel experience I have had in 25 years of traveling. If I wasn’t so tired I would have went to a different hotel.The place was dirty, the solid wood towel rack fell on top of the toilet (luckily I wasn’t under it), there was a roach in the room, and there was no soap available. It seems Hilton has given up on this place.

title: Not safe during the Delta wave of Covid
text:
I spent one night at this hotel during the surge in Delta-related Covid cases nationwide.

This is a twenty-story hotel. But for reasons I cannot fathom, it has only one operating elevator. As a result, the elevator cars are packed with guests during the morning hours. Some guests are masked, some are not. And ten people, some unmasked, in a small elevator car that stops every second or third floor is a recipe for transmission.

Maybe the other elevator is broken? Or maybe Hampton Inn doesn't want to pay to operate it? Either way, I felt very unsafe riding in it, and I'd recommend that folks worried about Covid transmission seriously consider a different facility.

title: Decent stay, value for money
text:
Stayed with my family at Hapmton inn for 4 nights from 20th July. 
Pros: Excellent location very close by Grand central terminal( 5 mins walk), chrysler building, UN hq etc. Time square, central prk etc is very close by. Courteous staff.
Cons: very small room to occupy 2 double beds, limited/ repeated food served as breakfast, very small dining area, old furnitre.

title: Friendly Staff. Great Location. Small rooms!
text: The staff were very nice and friendly. Good location for travel or transfer to subway stations. Rooms are on the smaller side with outdated furnitures below the standard compared to other hamptons/hiltons hotels.

title: Friendly Staff
text: Had a great weekend stay!  Dashanda was super friendly and got us checked in early. We had similar experiences with the rest of the staff.  Location was perfect for our needs.  Will definitely stay here again.

title: Worth the money
text: The location of the hotel was perfect, and was within walking distance of Times Square. Also, the price was worth the stay. Complimentary breakfast was good. The hotel staff were helpful and helped us with any questions during our stay.

title: Family stay of 4
text: We enjoyed our stay. Location was very convenient to uptown and downtown. Short walk to union station. Very satisfied with this booking amd hampton inn overall. Definitely coming back to this place if visiting New York

title: July 2021 Vacation
text: I was satisfied overall with the cleanliness of my room, but I did not like that there was no refrigerator. The air & hot water worked great the whole time. I did report that the vending machine broke and took my money, but it was never fixed. I would consider staying here again!

title: Convenient location, but VERY old facilities
text:
Stayed here overnight. Staff was friendly and the hotel's location is quite convenient. However, all the facilities are VERY old and do not seem to go through maintenance. Furniture in the dining area was worn out and even the cushions were peeling off. 

Room was clean, but doors would not properly close. The bathroom air extractor was not working. TV remote was unresponsive and the minimum volume setting was way too high.

Breakfast was good and the staff was very supportive.

The only reason I would come back to this hotel would be because it's conveniently located close to Grand Central. Otherwise, I would choose other Hilton properties that seem to be better maintained.

title: Great Stay
text: I prefer staying at Hilton Hotels and this was the first time in NY that I stayed at the Hampton Inn and was very happy with my stay and the reception by all the staff.  Will definitely be back and stay there in the future

title: Close to The Surgicare Center of Manhattan
text: This was the perfect place for us! We traveled in because my daughter was having back surgery at the Surgicare of Manhattan so we needed some place close. The hotel was very convenient to Grand Central and also the Center. We walked the whole time, and it was even close enough for my daughter to walk back after her surgery. There are places nearby to eat outside of the hotel and it really served the purpose for what we needed. We felt safe and it was easy to find our way. I’m not sure about parking though, we took the train, and that was walking distance. Even after back surgery. If you’re looking for somewhere to stay if you’re having a procedure done, and are looking for a reasonably priced hotel, and convenience, stay here! I would stay again. If I had to say anything I’d change, the beds were just a little hard for my liking, but honestly, that’s it.

title: La mejor ubicación
text: Hotel excelentemente ubicado, cerca de estaciones del metro y múltiples lugares de interés como la biblioteca pública, Gran Central, Empire State, The vessel, 5a Av, edificio Chrysler y el próximo mirador Summit. Cómodo y con muy buenas medidas de bioseguridad.

title: Highly recommend this hotel
text:
Great hotel in a fantastic location. Rooms were very clean (and spacious for Manhattan), with comfortable beds and a good breakfast. Easy access to Grand Central station for the subway, and walking distance to pretty much anything in Midtown. We also  liked catching the 42nd street bus a block away and taking it straight across town. 

While this isn’t the biggest or newest hotel around, it met our needs perfectly and we enjoyed our experience immensely. 
I want to show extra appreciation to the manager, Brianne, who helped us with tickets to the Empire State Building and went the extra mile to make sure we got what we needed. She, along with all the staff, made our stay even better. We will be back!

title: Quick visit to Manhattan
text: Exceptionally nice hotel to stay at very very close to Grand Central Station so it’s very easy to walk around also within walking distance to Times Square good location parking available nearby. All kinds of access to move around by train or bus are available from this site

title: Great location, friendly staff, clean rooms
text: This is a great place to stay! Convenient to subways, buses, great bars and restaurants nearby! Staff is very accommodating and hotel is very clean! Good value. I would recommend this hotel to my friends and family.

title: No housekeeping for a 3-night stay?
text:
Great location, decent room and amenities.  I was surprised when I returned to my room after a very long day to find everything exactly the way that I left it - meaning there was no housekeeping service.  Not the end of the world, but I mentioned it to the guy at the desk the next morning and asked if it could be done that day.  He then asked me, "when did you schedule your housekeeping for?"  

I did not realize that was a "thing", and told him so.  He said that yes, all housekeeping must be scheduled now.  When I informed him I was unaware and would like to "schedule" for that day, he said they were busy and could not clean my room that day.  After a little back and forth, he said because I was "only" staying 3 nights, that they generally do not provide housekeeping for that length of a stay.  A few thoughts on that:

A - It would have been nice to know - maybe I would have left things a little neater
B - Really?  No housekeeping for a 3-night stay?
C - If you're not going to clean the room, maybe at least pop in to replenish things like towels, wash cloths, etc.?

title: Great hotel
text: Quiet, great location in Manhattan. Close or less than 15 minutes from most attractions in Time Square and Midtown. Honestly the rooms aren’t the biggest but they were definitely sound proof... enjoyed my stay and will definitely stay again

title: Friendly staff
text: Great location, friendly staff and comfortable room. I had a king size bed, private bathroom, and view of the city. Train station was a 5 minute walk and there was a Coffee shop nearby that was great!

title: Loud smokers
text: Hotel was ok, but filled with guests smoking cigarettes, pot and who knows what else.  Very loud.  I saw a lot of teenagers without parents.   Don’t stay with your kids, they will get no sleep.  And if you have asthma definitely stay away.  I don’t know how the smoke alarms didn’t go off.

title: Not cleanly
text: I left after about an hour of staying there. No one was at the front desk for me to let them know. The room was not clean, and had an odor, and there was a lot of noise coming from neighbors. I did not stay overnight.

title: Not what I expected.
text: Staff was nice. Unfortunately this property is rundown and is not on par with other Hampton inns. Room was tiny and old. Some people were smoking pot in the property. Also some of them were not following safety rules. Boxed breakfast was bad. Heating system in the room was not working and although I addressed them about this, they were not able to fix it. First time I feel disappointed at a Hampton inn.

title: Wonderful staff, super clean rooms
text: As a Diamond meme be it’s fair to say that I’ve stayed at just about every Hilton in NYC. I’ve stayed at his Hampton a few times & I must say that they have the friendliest staff in town. The rooms are always clean & fresh.

title: Great value but dirty rooms.
text: Great prices for rooms but recently they upgraded the charge per room but makes no sense as the rooms are always dirty and have a super dirty musty smell when you enter they advertise they use Lysol all over the room but nothing smells. When I use Lysol one spray you smell it all over the room for hours. They are just Liers

title: Me encanto ,muy buenos empleados  Gracias a todos espero pronto regresar nuevamente Ashley y demás empleados mil Gracias
text: Thanks for your kind, Thanks Ashley. Son excelentes empleado el servicio muy bueno, el lugar muy limpio. De verdad estoy super contento y espero volver pronto. Un abrazo desde Puerto Rico  a todos ustedes.

title: Roach Roomates
text: Check in was simple and the room was clean and very quiet. You won’t hear the outside city noise while in your room. The bed was comfortable and the pillows were decent. However... I didn’t know i would be sharing the room with a few small roaches. They seem to be coming from the bathroom. Never saw any in the main room.... I would sit on the toilet and 2 would come out to greet me. 3 other ones came out while i was showering. Thats the only negative experience i had at this hotel. Otherwise, the staff are very nice and personable.

title: Good Mid-Range Hotel - Typical Hampton Inn
text:
I have a preference for Hilton family properties and chose this Hampton Inn for my overnight stay in NYC based on price and location.  It was a good choice, and I will return again. 

Check-in was quick and cordial.  Rooms are small, which is often the case with mid-range NYC hotels, but I didn't need a large room, as my primary mission was to sleep after a late-night arrival.   Bed was comfortable; in-room climate control worked perfectly, and the room was spotlessly clean.  I requested a room in a quiet area away from areas known to be noisy, and this one fit the bill.  

There's 24-hour coffee (but not 24-hour decaf) and tea in the lobby.  Grand Central is a short walk away.

For simple, modest accommodations in a good location, this hotel is a good choice.

title: Super clean, quiet and friendly
text: The Hampton Inn was fantastically clean, quiet and the room (typical smallish NYC size) was in superb condition. Nothing was dated and amenities were freshly stocked. The check-in staff were super-friendly. Great location and great value.

title: Small Rooms, Great Location
text: Think of this hotel as your typical suburban Hampton Inn flipped on its side. The rooms are typical small NYC hotel rooms but if you aren't spending much time in them they are fine. The location is excellent if you have business around grand central and there are plenty of bars and restaurants within walking distance up 2nd ave.

title: Most disgusting hotel 🏨 I’ve ever stayed in
text:
Dried up spit on elevator. Fingerprints all over elevator. Stains on carpet. Juice or blood on floor by check in. Unsavory characters. Front of hotel has trash. I don’t know if housekeeping works on weekends.  Considering we are in the era of COVID this unnerved me like you wouldn’t believe. I’m shocked that this is a Hilton property looking like this. I’m a gold member and have stayed all over USA and international. Never, ever have I run into something that looked like this.  I saw this same room on Groupon for sixty dollars on a Saturday night FYI. I would’ve took more pics but didn’t want to ruin the trip for the other person.  Also, there is no grab and go breakfast. You as a guest are allowed to grab what you’d like. Doesn’t feel safe at all!

Positives

Elevator is super quick ride!
Air conditioning is super cold!
Bed and pillows were soft!
Water pressure was great!
Neutrogena products available. 
Free toiletry Kit if you forget your toothbrush and toothpaste.

title: Had to Cancel due to the world wide virus
text:
As many travellers have had to cancel holidays due to the virus. I want to share with you my experience in getting refunds during this time.

Once we became aware we could not leave Australia, this Hotel was the first in America to give us a refund. Once our travel agent contacted them they quickly refunded even though we had paid up front for a non-refundable booking.

Other hotels and airline held on to our money for over 6 months before we got a refund.

We chose this Hotel based on reviews from Tripadvisor.
The fact they refunded quickly shows that this is a very ethical Hotel that I would assume would be reflected in the staff service and care for customers.

Even though we did not get to see New York this year, I thought I should share this with people who like myself believe in treating travellers well leads to a better travelling experience and a desire to return.

title: nice hotel
text: the hotel close to the bus and the train they have lots of restaurants in the area. I wish they have microwave and refrigerator in the room,staff was very nice they didn't have a pool neither the price was not bad

title: Staff made us feel like family - very much appreciated
text: My mother and I stayed here several times at the start of 2020 (pre-COVID) when my mother had to have some out patient surgery in the city. The front desk staff was amazing - they made sure all our needs were met and went above and beyond with their hospitality and service. Super clean rooms, great breakfast, and met all of our extra requests (fridge in room, etc). Right up the street from Grand Central. My wallet was taken by another guest (long story) during the stay and the staff were all so supportive for the 24 hours it was missing. Special shout outs to Imelda Castilla, Keila Rivera, Ashley C, Corinthia and Borna. My mother and I will never forget you ladies and will definitely book any  NYC stays at your hotel. Sorry it took me so long to write this review!

title: Wonderful location!
text:
I just came back staying one night Sept 5th.  The location is excellent. Only 7 minutes walk from Grand Central. Safe has lots of eating out options. However due to COVD~19 NYC has still limited. But there are lots of option. Deli is open . Coffee shops are open. 

The room was great . Lots of outlet to charge your necessary needs ! LOL   Bathroom is big enough.
However I have noticed that this hotel must be quiet old. The shower door on the bottom was bit dirty but not terrible.
but it's just perfect 
.Bed was nice clean room!  Location location! Safe .

I would stay another time again!

title: OK, but there are better options out there
text:
This is a no frills  hotel, at least during the pandemic.   Don't expect the front desk to have any toiletries if you forget  something.   No temperature check done.
 Coffee is on all day which is nice, but breakfast is extremely basic.   There is a convenience store on the block  as an alternative.    
The staff was nice during my stay and the location is good.
My room seemed clean, but when I arrived, the lobby carpet was dirty.
Would I stay here again?   Probably not.

title: FLEAS in hotel room, infected bug bites, and NO REFUND!
text: Please do not stay here! The room I was in had FLEAS and I was bitten severely during my first night there to the point where I had to seek medical attention and was prescribed antibiotics. I spoke to the manager, showed them my bites, and even physically handed them a flea that I had collected from their room, but despite this, they claimed "they conducted an investigation and found nothing." They refused to refund me for my 1 week stay even though I checked out after the first night. Save yourself the headache and find somewhere else to stay.

title: Friendly City Welcome
text:
My husband and stayed her for five nights at start of February to celebrate my 40th Birthday.  The staff on the front reception were warm, bubbly and very helpful from the moment we arrived.  The hotel is not very big, but has everything you need for a city break.  Our room was at the front of the building and it was very clean and well equipped.  The bed was honestly the most comfortable hotel bed I have slept on 10 out of 10.The shower was very roomy and constantly stocked up with supplies. We made good use of the breakfast which was a great saving and convenient, it was well stocked up and the staff continuously refilled everything.  Coffee  all day was also very useful. I was even surprised one night of my stay with a lovely treat for my birthday and the bedroom door colourfully decorated, it was a lovely touch.

The location of this hotel is very good it is less than two minute walk from Grand Central where you can get a train or sub-way anywhere. However, we walked from this hotel across to Broadway and Times Square a number of times and it was an easy walk.  

Would definitely return and recommend to others.

title: Prime Spot for a Stay
text:
The hotel is situated just 2 blocks away from the Grand Central Station. Easily walkable if you are not carrying a huge luggage. For close company you will have the Chrysler building, Permanent Mission of India, Avis car rental next door, couple of Starbucks a block away, a Dunkin Donut outlet across the street, The Westin NY Grand Central in the opposite lane and the UN Head Quarters at a walking distance of 15 mins tops. So, you can imagine, how prime the location can be.

I am Hilton Honors member and my reason to select this property was obvious. For my Christmas and New Year vacation this was my 4th property of Hamptons where I stayed after Berlin, Chicago and Providence. I arrived at 3:00 PM and due to heavy rush the check-in was not permitted until 5:00 PM. The manager was apologetic to all and offered them hot beverages. As expected after check-in, I was not surprised at all- The rooms were extremely small- given that NYC is one of the most expensive cities to live in hence the real state is prime too. Free breakfast came as part of the Hampton Promise with every booking. As promised by the manager I was offered a late checkout as per my request which was extremely kind. 

Good things about the property: 
Location: Prime 5 Star
Staff: Helpful and cordial 5 Star
Sleep Quality: Peaceful 5 Star 
Cleanliness: Neat 4.8 Star

Not so good thing about the Property: 
Breakfast: Passable 2.5 Star (No offense but that’s the case with the other 3 properties of Hampton I stayed in US as well – Chicago, Providence as well as Manhattan. Only surprise was Hampton by Hilton in Berlin City Centre where the Breakfast was just amazing – Probably because it was Europe)

Allow me to Thank all the staff here who made my stay memorable.

title: Loved Our Stay
text: I live in Manhattan and my family needed a place to stay while our apartment was being renovated. We stayed here twice this month and both times we had an enjoyable experience. The hotel is in a very convenient location. It's about 5 blocks from Grand Central station. The staff is amazing and so friendly. The rooms are very clean and breakfast is good. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

title: Work trip for 2 days.
text: The Hampton Inn Grand Central was close to where I was working. The room was very comfortable. I didn't spend much time in the room but it was quiet and I slept well. If your staying for longer than a couple days you may want to ask for a fridge in the room.

title: Ótima escolha em Manhattan
text:
Sou fã e usuário dos Hotéis Hampton em todo o mundo, este hotel em especial tem localização excelente permitindo acesso rápido aos transportes públicos e pontos turísticos. Serve um café da manhã simples mas muito bom para as necessidades do dia a dia , com excelentes produtos. Recepção eficiente e cordial. Quarto confortável e limpo, para melhorar seria bom ter um frigo bar.
Único ponto negativo é não pontuar e não ter benefícios no HHonors, pela compra ter sido feita por operadora de turismo

title: Traditional tourist hotel - quiet area
text:
Traditional tourist hotel close to Central Station, so close that you can almost see the back of Central Station from the street in front of the hotel.
43rd St. is a quiet street, so if you need to breathe some fresh air, you can relax in the area in front of the hotel.
The room: Our room was furnished with 2 king size beds, a dresser and closet. The furniture was large, dark, heavy and filled most of the room. It was a big minus that the bathroom door was a sliding door so the toilet could not be shut off. Not all electrical outlets worked.
Breakfast Restaurant: Large selection that varied slightly from day to day. Not the wild luxury, but we were satisfied.
Location: For us, it was convenient when we arrived by train to Central Station.

If you are looking for a hotel room you only need to sleep in, then I would highly recommend the hotel.

title: Family visit
text: Stayed in Hampton Inn grand Central I Feb with family 2 adults n 2 kids. Loved the hotel no resort fees n the added bonus of free breakfast which was lovely. Rooms were on the small size but you only sleep in them. Beds so comfy please 2as spotless and staff very nice. Definitely be booking with them again

title: Convenient location. Great stay!
text: As usual, Hampton Inn did not disappoint.  The location is great.  The side street was quiet and located only one block from 42nd Street. The room was comfortable and clean and the bedding was relaxing.  I did not make it to the complementary breakfast, and the wifi appeared a little slow, but ultimately a great stay.  I will definitely choose this location again during my next business trip to NY.

title: Great location; solid value
text: Easy access to all parts of Manhattan, friendly front desk staff that went out of their way to take care of me, great gym, good breakfast.  Room was slightly bigger than typical Manhattan rooms in this price range.  Absolutely will return!

title: Great hotel for a quick city break
text:
Perfectly located, very helpful & knowledgeable staff. Breakfast is the classic Hampton fare. Rooms are Modern & clean, average sized for mid-town Manhattan. The only negative point is that the room doors slam shut when left to close by themselves. During the day it’s hardly noticeable; however late at night or late morning you can hear it. 
We LOVED our stay and will certainly return.

title: Great hotel/location.
text: The hotel is just five minutes walk from Grand Central. Has a soothing and warm shower. Breakfast is great too. The room is just right and the heating system was perfect for us. The staff are wonderful and knowledgeable.

title: Excelente experiencia!
text: El hotel cuenta con los servicios necesarios para una excelente estadía. La habitación muy confortable y limpia. Muy buena ubicación y el personal es muy amable y atento a resolver cualquier problema o inquietud. Volvería sin pensarlo dos veces.

title: Hotel with great location and great value
text: We stayed this hotel for a week. We are family of four (with two teenagers) and booked a room with city view and with 2 douple beds. Room had everything that we needed with great stay at the city. Hotel is at great location, very close to Grand Central, and from there you can reach all parts of Manhattan with so many Subway lines to choose for. It was also nice to have a complimentary breakfast.  Staff was always very friendly and helpful.  Room was always clean when we came back after long day at the city.  Will definitely stay here again!

title: Très bien situé
text:
hotel très central et proche de tout les lieux à visiter dans Manhattan. Chambre spacieuse et confortable avec excellente literie et bonne insonorisation. Salle de bain au bon volume avec articles de toilette. Bon petit déjeuner copieux et varié. Salle de petit déjeuner un peu petite et canapés usés qui donnent mauvaise impression. Point positif pour les boissons chaudes gratuites toute la journée.
Ascenseur souvent en panne ( un sur les 2 heureusement). Personnel sympathique et serviable.

title: great location and value - room just ok
text: Great location and by NYC standards, the rooms was very reasonably priced.  Staff was friendly.  But room is very small, particularly for 2 beds.  And bathroom has just a sliding door so you hear everything from bedroom

title: Good location
text: The hotel is nice and just what I needed for a one night business trip. Location is good- walking distance to Central Park, Time Square, Grand Central. Complimentary breakfast was ok- typical, nothing special. The check in doesn't start till 3 pm and they woulnd't let me check in until exactly 3pm. I would probably stay there again for a short business trip.

title: Good hotel
text:
Good location near to grand central. Room was spacious and clean with a good shower. Friendly staff.
Good selection at breakfast.
Would definitely come back here and recommend this hotel to everyone. .

title: NYC Museum visit
text:
The location is good. The staff was very helpful and friendly.  We found some great restaurants in the area.  And, it was very close to Grand Central. Always a plus!
    On the downside, the two elevators were alternately broken (or turned off) the four days we were there. Long waits for elevator, particularly during breakfast hours.

title: Quick trip to NYC with family
text: Very close to Grand Central and a fairly easy walk to Times Square (15 min). Hotel staff was friendly and helpful. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Only reason for a 4 star was the continental breakfast was not up to par with most other Hampton Inns. I would definitely stay again.

title: Average but close to Grand Central
text: The highlight of this hotel is the proximity to Grand Central Station which was about a 7 minute walk. The hotel wasn't bad but there is room for improvement especially with the breakfast selection and staff.  The bathroom is a little tight but the shower is amazing. The room was pretty clean just a little dusty in a few spots.

title: Hotel mediano
text: Hotel para uma curta estadia apenas. Quartos com tamanho bom, mas limpeza deixou a desejar (tanto que encontramos no quarto um passaporte e um pé de meia, dos hóspedes anteriores). Café da manhã bom, mas MUITO tumultuado nos finais de semana. Aliás, essa foi uma característica deste hotel: muito movimento! Apesar disso, os quartos são silenciosos. Não dispõe de frigobar e microondas nos quartos, caso fosse preciso, tinha que solicitar na recepção. Ponto positivo: muito próximo a Grand Central e disponibilizam garrafa de água gratuitamente (mediante solicitação).

title: Staff is so kind and considerate, even in the wee hours of the morning!.  That in itself is 5 stars!!!
text: A great experience for business travel with several colleagues.  When you depart at 5:30 am and the staff on duty at that time makes sure you are fed and have snacks for your travel.  He did not have to do that but I appreciated the kindness. :-)

title: Great Location, but has issues
text:
We had 4 in our group (45, 21, 19, & 16 years of age). Stayed 3 nights (Fri - Mon)  My overall rating was - it's so-so.  I'll be honest, I was looking for other places to stay up until the last minute, as I was just not getting the warm and fuzzies about this place.  I should have listened to my gut - but, the price was what keep me from canceling my reservation.  I have stayed at many Hampton Inns in several states across the US and this one is by far my least favorite.  

I'll start off with the GOOD: 
Price - the price was great, as I got a Long Weekenders special; as I said above, the price was really the only reason we stayed here.

Location - great location as it's only 2 blocks from Grand Central Station and you can practically take any train out of there to get wherever you want to go.   

Arrived early and was able to check in - this was nice as we could start our visit as soon as we arrived.  

The BAD:  it's a SMALL hotel.  
The room:  We were in room 1106 - 2 double beds.  The room was very small, there was not a lot of space for our luggage (4 suitcases).  We had to keep everything in our suitcases and just "live" out of them.  The beds were a little stiff for our preference, the pillows were flat, by the last night, by back was really hurting.  The heater/AC unit made a sound like a wind tunnel - very annoying when trying to sleep. And I noticed on the last day - the bathroom ceiling had a small leak.   

The lobby - small.  Got very crowded with all the people. Seems there were a few large groups there during our stay.

The breakfast area - small.  The area where you get your food is very tiny and got very crowded getting your food.  And because of the crowd food was always out.  Eggs not so good.  Sausage ok.  Best to get a bagel or yogurt.  The wait to make a waffle was really long, they should add a couple more waffle makers to speed up the process.  

The elevators - small and SLOW.  Had to wait a very long time for the elevators, and once they came they were full, so often times you had to wait on another.

The hallways on your floor - very hot and very narrow, hard to navigate with a lot of luggage. I think there are only like 8 rooms on each floor.   You had to walk single file and if others were in the hallway at the same time - forget about it.  Also, there are not ice makers on every floor.  Our floor had one, but it was not working, so had to go down to floor 8 - but again took a long time because of the slow elevators.  

So, final thoughts:  would I stay here again - maybe?  If I was traveling by myself for maybe a night - sure.  Traveling with my husband/family or for more than one night - NO!  It just wasn't big enough in all aspects for a family and the beds were just not comfortable.  I like the idea of the free breakfast, but honestly, you can grab a bagel or breakfast sandwich pretty cheap, so I don't know if it's worth it.

title: Fabulous stay in October 2019
text:
Had a fantastic time here last October.  I travelled with my husband and stayed for six nights.

The room was very nice and well decorated.  The complimentary buffet breakfast was also a great way to start our day without taking up valuable sightseeing time and was well presented and looked after.

The location - probably the best place we've stayed in Manhatten - great connections to all the sights.

Shout out to Ashley and her staff.  We had encountered Ashley the previous year at another Hampton hotel and we had a nice catch up.  Very nice, helpful staff throughout the hotel.

Will definitely stay here again.

title: Ashley and staff were great
text:
My initial phone call regarding my gift certificate and booking with Imelda was an example of great customer service. When we arrived, the greeting from Ashley and staff was truly pleasant. Plus a complimentary water bottle at checkin
Thanks Hampton Inn

title: I would definitelly recommend it!
text: It is a very nice and clean place. The service is good -- no complaints. The location is also good -- just a few blocks from Times Square. The complimentary continental breakfast in the morning is a definite plus. They also have good coffee in the lobby 24/7.

title: Hotel próximo à Grand Central
text: Hotel bem localizado, distante apenas 2 quarteirões da Grand Central. Atendimento muito cortês. Quartos limpos e espaçosos. Internet de boa qualidade. Café da manhã muito bom para os padrões americanos.

title: Great location, great value for money!
text: Great value; great location a few minutes from the Grand Central terminal and the United Nations; very comfortable bed; a lovely, generous breakfast for NY! This place is certainly  worth every dollar you spend there.

title: Food was great, a lot of variety! I would be Happy To Stay there again in the future!
text: With the exception of one very uncomfortable incident, my stay was very good. The Front Desk Staff were knowledgeable and courteous.  I would like to extend my sincere appreciation to one of the Front Desk Staff, Alex, who was extremely helpful and respectful as well. I would like to commend the Management of the Hampton Inn for employing such an outstanding employee.  I was very impressed with the convenient location of the property.  On the down side I was not too happy about what was classified as "A City View" Room. Unless it was meant to encompass the fact that I was on a high floor. The elevators were quite fast and available with very little waiting. They even had TV monitors inside which served to calm customers, I thought!

title: Great value, great location right close to Grand Central
text: I enjoyed my stay.  Room was clean, well-lit, bed was  very comfortable, and the bathroom clean and modern, with a enough  vanity space for my tolietries.  Plenty of accessible outlets.  New thermostat and heating and A/C allowed me to warm or cool room temperature quickly.  Air quality excellent. Extra towel rack by the sink. Breakfast room staff was very nice and helpful.  I like having Chobani Grerk yogurt as an option for breakfast.  Decaf coffee was excellent.

title: Excellent stay
text: We were in Manhattan for a birthday dinner. The staff was super helpful (I requested a mini fridge and extra pillow, both came quickly.) The location was perfect (near GCT)   The room was "cozy" (though average by NYC standards) but perfectly adequate for our quick overnight trip, and w/breakfast included, a GREAT value. We'd definitely stay again.

title: Excellent choice for people to stay
text: It was the best decision we made to stay at Hampton Inn Grand Central.  The location is just perfect, the staff very friendly and helpful.  The room was surprisingly clean and well equipped with amenities.

title: Buena ubicación, desayuno gratis
text: Excelente ubicación, muy cerca de grand central, desayuno gratis muy aceptable. Es el único hotel que encontré que no cobra un extra por noche, aunque si piden depósito como en todos pero éste es reembolsable, es una buena opción si lo recomiendo

title: Clean modern and comfortable
text: Clean modern and comfortable rooms. The staff were very nice and warm. The complimentary breakfast was just great to start your day. The location is quiet and close to the Grand Central station and UN headquarters.

title: Excelente estadía
text: Excelente estadía, viajé con mi familia y la pasamos increíble, nos incluyeron servicio de desayuno, el cual estaba muy conpleto y muy variado. Las habitaciones amplias y limpias. El personal muy atento y la ubicación del lugar muy céntrico. Teniamos a dos cuadras caminando el subway

title: Viagem para participar de um evento
text: Estávamos em um grupo e participamos da NRF 2020. O Hampton Inn foi escolhido por ficar em uma excelente localização e também por apresentar um ótimo custo benefício. Quarto bom, cama boa, internet boa, bom café da manhã e ótimo atendimento. Para viagens a passeio ou a negócios em NY, recomendo este hotel.

title: Excelente
text: El lugar ofrece la mejor relación precio beneficio, el personal atento, las instalaciones muy bien cuidadas, su ubicación inmejorable, alojarme en Hampton Inn hizo que el viaje tuviera un plus de comodidad

title: Nice and clean hotel!
text: 5 minuten lopen van Grand Central Terminal. Schone douche en voldoende. De kamer was wel aan de kleine kant maar voldoende voor het slapen. Het schijnt dat het normaal is voor New Yorkse begrippen. De rest van de tijd waren wij de hele tijd onderweg. Alle bekendste plekken in Manhattan zijn binnen handbereik met de Subway. Zelfs Brooklyn is te doen. Het hotel is schoon en het ontbijt is voldoende om de dag te starten. Wel wegwerp borden en bestek. Wij waren ook in de staat Arizona en daar was ook hetzelfde. Waarschijnlijk is het normaal voor een 3 sterren hotel. De dames in de receptie waren vriendelijke en gaven goede adviezen. Ook Alex!! Bedankt voor het fijne tijd en zeker tot ziens. Ik zal deze hotel zeker aanbevelen.

title: Great place in mid-town
text:
Close to Grand Central Station, United Nations. Many close restaurants, stores, transportation.
Rooms are clean, roomy, and quiet. Management friendly and helpful.
Good place to stay for New York City business or vacation trips.

title: Wonderful Anniversary Weekend
text: Stayed here for our Anniversary weekend.  Enjoyed the hotel.  Nice customer service.  Breakfast was good and hot every morning.  Liked the convenience of having places close to us and being able to jump on the subway when needing to travel outside immediate area.

title: Mycket bra
text:
Snabb incheckning och trevlig personal. Wi-fi fungerar bra överallt på hotellet, man får logga in en gång/dygn. Rummen är i ok storlek för att vara på Manhattan, många andra är mindre. Skön säng och bra badrum. Många eluttag dessutom. Säkerhetsskåp som rymmer en normalstor laptop finns på rummen.

Ingick frukost för oss och den är ok, dock trist att det inte finns riktiga tallrikar, bestick och glas, detta känns budget och bara onödigt även om det är standard i landet. Kaffe, the och varm choklad finns tillgängligt dygnet runt.

I källaren finns ett bra gym, dator och skrivare samt 

I samma kvarter finns hyrbilsfirmor samt några restauranger som Lukes Lobster. Matbutik fem minuter bort. Till Grand Central går man på tio minuter

title: Great stay
text: The location is great, the rooms were comfortable, the only request would be that if there were some salads for breakfast since we stayed for 6 consecutive nights, we got pretty much tired of eating same food.

title: Viagem dos 50
text: Quarto confortável, bem insonorizado e aconchegante. Boa localização a dois passos da estação Grand Central. Staff muito simpático e com café e chá sempre disponivel no lounge. Pode encher garrafa de água no hotel a custo zero.

title: Great stay
text: Very friendly staff, extremely helpful and overall a positive experience. This was my second time here and it was even better than I remembered. Will definitely return in the future if needed. Thank you!

title: Great location! Good breakfast.
text: We stayed here with the family and it was conveniently located to public transportation and sites we wanted to see. Good breakfast. Clean rooms. Friendly staff - even under a stressful situation (late linens) they remained professional and respectful. We would stay here again when visiting NYC!

title: Disappointing for the price
text: Quality of room as expected but 1/2 issues eg not enough towels, cleanliness just ok. But main issue hotel way too hot & poor air conditioning means open window, loud noise from the street / construction & therefore very little sleep. Plus breakfast room is small so expect to queue for breakfast

title: The front desk and the hotel staff are all exceptional my friendly and helpful!
text: The hotel front desk and staff went out of their way to make sure that you are taken care of (whatever that I requested). For example, I asked for extra towels and blankets (they didn’t have them right away but apologized) and later, someone brought them up to the room when they were still warm and fresh out of the dryer; even more amazingly, he refused to accept tips!

title: We were double-charged and lack of money for the rest of the holidays
text: The hotel double charged us for our staying. When we tried to reach them to find out what happened they put us on the line and dropped the phone. Finally after several calls to Hilton Customer Care and Booking we got to know t was their mistake. What we have now: a fortune bill for the mobile roaming, no money for the rest of the holiday due to the banking periods, no written confirmation from the hotel that they have finally released the sum. This is beyond awful service for the well-known hotel. We have one more prepaid reservation in Hampton Inn Brooklyn but now I am frustrated to deal with this hotel again.

title: pessimo
text: camere per niente insonorizzate.. per di più è una camera comunicante fornita di uno scarso sistema per evitarne l apertura e incontrare gli altri ospiti. struttura vecchia. di positivo sicuramente la posizione.

title: Great stay and great staff!
text: Alex at the front desk, and Nancy in the dining area were extremely wonderful and helpful during our visit!  Location was excellent due to use of Grand Central Station which provided easy access to anywhere, and walking distance for our tour to the United Nations.

title: Another Great Stay!
text: Fourth stay at this location. Visiting our daughter in the city for the holidays this trip. Convenient to Grand Central Station. New York 99-cent pizza between the hotel and Grand Central! Clean rooms, friendly staff. Thank you again, Hampton Inn Manhattan Grand Central!

title: quartier tranquille
text:
L'ensemble est assez positif. Le café et l'eau est à volonté toute la journée. Petit déj inclus dans le prix plutôt sympa.
Dommage que pas de frigo dans la chambre (assez petites) et il faut parfois attendre longtemps pour l'ascenseur.
J'ai trouvé aussi assez peu commerçant et limite le fait qu'ils facturent 4 dollars pour recevoir un colis ?! Tout ça pour ça, au prix où est la chambre ?!

title: Well located hotel, but rooms are small
text: We selected the hotel based on location, ratings, and cost. We found it to be well run, with a decent complimentary breakfast spread. Our only complaint was that the room was too small for a couple. There is no space to set out two suitcases, and there is no buffer between the bed and the bathroom.

title: New York holiday
text: 4 of us stayed here on the 3rd Dec for 5 nights. What a great wee fantastic value for money hotel . Spotlessly clean room great showers, comfy beds, no noise. Staff are so friendly and helpful. Breakfast included in the price as was 24hr access to tea, coffee, hot chocolate. I would definitely use this hotel again.

title: Good hotel ina food position
text: Siamo stati in periodo natalizio, buona la colazione anche se la sala addetta è un po' piccola, posizione perfetta per raggiungere Times Square e l'Emorire State Building a piedi in pochi minuti, consigliato.

title: Nice!
text: Really nice hotel, great service, convenient location. Hotel staffs were really nice, tried to help every way possible. Rooms were little small than I expected. And there was no refrigerator in the room. Everything else was great.

title: Great customer service and bring ear plugs
text:
Great little hotel in a very quiet neighborhood, within walking distance to many places. 

Upon arrival, we asked to confirm that our room didn't have a connecting door to the next room, because we always had bad experience with noise from the next room traveling over. Alex checked and saw on the chart that there was no connecting door, and sent us to our room. But after we entered, we found there was a connecting door. We called downstairs, and the other woman apologized and luckily, she found us another room by sending someone up to check first. We changed our room to another floor. Though both rooms are on the same line (04), one had a connecting door but the other didn't. I suspect that the chart in the system is not accurate. We were so glad it got resolved. It was a fully booked hotel and if we couldn't change our room, we would have miserable two nights without sleep. 

More sound insulation for the room door would be nice. We could hear other rooms' doors slamming at night. In the morning we could hear kids playing in the hallway and having a great time. However we needed our sleep but couldn't!

title: Good location, clean room
text: We picked this hotel based on the brand and the location. We were able to walk to most everything we wanted to see in New York. It was a clean place to sleep and the waffle bar was GREAT! Elevators were a bit slow.

title: Great place
text: Walking distance to Times Square and surrounding areas. Close to the Grand Central Subway. Small rooms however, view was great and this hotel had unbeatable rates. Staff was helpful.Will definitely stay again.

title: Christmast trip
text:
Me and my family visited the big apple for Christmas 
The service of this hotel was great
Location was great
Breakfast is pretty good and delicious 
Rooms are clean
Employees are very helpful and educated
We will definetaly be back

title: Great deal
text: Typical Hampton Inn — clean, comfortable bed, good breakfast, friendly and very helpful staff who gave recommendations for eating and sightseeing and helped us with accurate information for getting to the airport when we left. Location is great, 2 short blocks from Grand Central station, so it’s convenient for using the subway to go downtown, but you’re also able to walk to Times Square. The Chrysler Building is one block away and Empire State was fairly close. Plenty of places to eat and drugstores in the area. On the east side of Manhattan so it’s good for getting to/from LGA. Taxi when we arrived was $40 and the hotel arranged a car service to pick us up when we left (cost a little more, but we wanted the comfort and convenience). We had a “city view” room which was just some office buildings, but still nice. The Chrysler Bldg. May have been visible from the corner rooms. Great value for the money, would definitely stay there again!

title: Nothing special hotel
text: This hotel has good location and accessibility. The rooms and the beds are just OK. Staff are also just OK for friendliness, which is not very uncharacteristic for the location. There is also an OK gym that is helpful.

title: Superb location
text: The room we had (1003) was average size and NOT small, although the bathroom was small with a sliding door.  However, it was clean, QUIET (yes, in New York City and I used the word QUIET!!!), and the location was perfect for our needs.  The therrmostat in the room seemed to have problems in that it was set to 74 and was cool, and only by setting it to 80 would the heat turn on, and we would then have to manually turn it "Off" when it reached the temperature that we wanted.  But frankly, this was a very minor issue and I got too busy to notify the Hotel so this is not at ALL a problem for me.  The complimentary breakfast was nice and there was room to sit for all.  I would actually be quite glad to return here as the service and location and breakfast and room were worth the reasonable price we paid (especially considering it is in Manhattan, after all).

title: Nice hotel with great staff
text: First time visitors to NYC and this hotel served as a the perfect hub for a great family holiday. Close to key attractions and the hop on hop off bus. Staff were very welcoming and helpful (eg, stored luggage, arranged limo to airport, etc). Very clean and orderly. Strongly recommend this hotel and would return.

title: Ok place to stay
text: Staff was not very accommodating if a change needed to be made. Location was convenient and payhs were well lit for night time travel. Room was average. Breakfast had plenty of options and the staff for that area was excellent and helpful!

title: Not the Hampton Inn’s Finest Moment?
text: I stayed at this property on business for one night.  The location was great...walked about 15 minutes to the tree at Rockefeller Center!  When I woke up in the morning to shower in preparation for my meeting, I had no shampoo!  Waited 10 minutes for the front desk to bring me some, and realized after they left that I was brought many bottles of everything but shampoo.  Once I finally had shampoo in hand, I realized there were no towels in my entire room!  Pro Tip - Inventory your room when you arrive to avoid delayed showers!

title: Will stay again!
text:
This hotel is supremely CLEAN with a friendly staff and a GREAT location in mid-town. It's just enough away from the crowds that it is quiet and easily accessible. I was impressed at how clean our room was, and sufficiently sized (by NYC standards). It's a couple blocks from Grand Central station, and taxis and raid/shares can easily access the front of the hotel. Also, having breakfast provided is a huge cost and time saver! And gluten free options! We stay at Hampton Inns for the reliability, and the Grand Central location does not disappoint! (Would give five stars if there was a tub.)
Friendly and helpful staff, and Claudia was the best!

title: Family Christmas and touring vacation.
text:
A little smaller than accustomed to for a Hampton Inn and I am upset that I heard Hilton owners have cut out the warm cookies when you check in. That stinks, maybe it’s time to go back to the other national brand hotel. 
     Pillows are horrible. Need to upgrade to offer firmer pillow choices. 
Some of the breakfast items were cold each day.

title: Good hotel in great Midtown Location
text: Hilton Honors member, stayed in many various properties.  Check in was seamless, reception was friendly and welcoming.  Room was clean and normal size by NYC standards. I would have given the hotel 5 stars but I couldn’t get the room any cooler than 68 degrees.  The room was very warm and it was hard to regulate the temperature so I had the window open for my entire stay. Normally this wouldn’t be a big deal, but the street noise didn’t really allow for a good night’s sleep. So, my choice was to either sweat to death or wake up intermittently during the night. I chose the latter. I would go back to this property but only if I could have the thermostat adjusted.

title: Done Right
text:
So it has been 4 and a half years since my last review of this hotel. We have stayed at a number of other places in Manhattan before and after that visit. Hampton Inns, and this one in particular, provide an excellent combination of value, cleanliness, cheerfulness and reliability that are just hard to beat.

Out on the highways, on an obscure part of road, at an airport or in the heart of a big city, you can count on a Hampton Inn to be a safe and welcoming place to hang your hat for a short stay. The rooms in this motel in the sky (with floors up to floor 21) are a little tight, but they have Hampton's wonderfully comfortable beds, spotless and well lit bathrooms, a good sized flat screen television and the typical Hampton "free" breakfast.

The micro closet would not be helpful for a long stay; the walls are a little thin; there is the typical Manhattan long wait for the elevators, but the outside soundproofing is excellent, the front desk personnel have genuine smiles and you are only two blocks from Grand Central and not far from anything you might want to see and do in Midtown. 

Stay here and put some of your savings into a good meal in town.

title: Hotel para descansar en New York
text:
Hotel bien situado, habitaciones amplias, comodas con una buena cama king size y un buen baño con amenities, secador de pelo,...,el precio incluye el desayuno que sin ser tremendo no esta mal y se puede salir bien desayunado a la calle.
Recomendable

title: Hotel Hampton
text: Muy agradecidos por todo. El personal sumamente atentos y agradables siempre ayudando para q la estadía sea perfecta. La ubicación super !!!! Sin dudas volveríamos. Desayuno muy variado. La limpieza excelente. Habitaciones muy cómodas.

title: Fantastic hotel, location and staff
text: Everything was perfect from check in to check out. Amazingly cheerful and helpful staff, close to transport links and free breakfast. Room was good size and kept spotlessly clean. Maintenance team dismantled plumbing to try and find my lost earring. Cannot recommend this place enough and would definitely return.

title: Great hotel, great location, great value
text: We stayed there for 4 nights. The hotel has a really good location, very close to grand central and therefore with very good subway/train/bus (to the airport) connections. The rooms are very clean, comfortable and quite roomy for the price/location. The employees are very helpful and friendly, and the amenities (including free cold water to drink) are also good. The breakfast buffet is quite ok and offers a great value for money. All around a really good hotel, 100% recommended.

title: I don't recommend! Broken elevator and keycards
text: Location is central and the room was okay. There was only 1 working elevator which took 10-15 mins to get you where you want to be. Also, the key cards for the room always malfunction, so for my short stay there I spent quite a while waiting for the elevator to come and for the key card to work. Some of the staff are not as friendly, and when I complained about the key cards, they did nothing! I don't recommend.

title: Nice hotel well located
text: We stayed there for 3 nights and really enjoyed the location. Very friendly staff. Breakfast okay. Our bedroom’s style was quite old but super clean. I would definitely recommend this hotel to a friend.

title: Great location, great staff, strange bathroom doors...
text:
Stayed for 4 nights.
Hotel staff are very friendly and attentive - always happy to go the extra mile if you just ask them, e.g. will give you a bottle of water if you ask and happy to look after luggage after you check out.
The breakfast included is ok. Albeit served on paper plates and with plastic forks. There is a waffle machine that is a big hit and a good selection of fruits, cakes, breads, porridge etc.
Free coffee throughout the day is also a nice touch.
The room was ok - reasonably small and had a sliding bathroom door rather than a conventional door. This meant the door never really closed and there were gaps down each side meaning you could see out / into the bathroom. So make sure you're comfortable seeing / hearing whoever you are sharing with when they're in the bathroom...
The location is also great, a couple of blocks walk to Grand Central, which is a great spot to get to most of New York from. 
Take a look at my profile for other food suggestions when in town.
Overall a great stay, just thought it's worth flagging the door situation - I'd have appreciated knowing this before booking.

title: Ottima scelta
text: Posizione davvero ottima per visitare la città. Staffs davvero cordiale. Colazione a buffet non ricchissima ma essenziale e comunque ben fatta. Pulizia delle camere ottima. Nel complesso una struttura molto semplice, senza troppe pretese, ma ben tenuta.

title: Teenie Weenie
text: You better get ready for a small room...teenie weenie size. If you played linebacker or tackle in college, this is not the room for you and a guest.  You have to offset the size of the room with the great location of this hotel. Close to 2 and 3rd Ave and Gran Central. The staff tries hard to do their best to help with your stay. The place is old.....elevator broke during our stay, the breakfast room is outdated but the place is clean. Would recommend the GM would develop a list of recommendation of nearby places to dine and other services. Spoke with one of the front end person who could not recommend anything because " she had been thee only 3 months." Time for her to learn,I'd say. This write up is not to discourage folks from staying there but if size matters for you when choosing a room....might want to look elsewhere.

title: Excelente, incrível, voltaria com certeza!
text: Hotel aconchegante, limpo, cheiroso, atendentes simpáticos, guardam sua mala sem cobrar taxa, não tem taxa de resort, com café e chocolate quente a vontade 24h por dia, oferecem água e snaks para você, simplesmente amei e vou voltar com certeza.

title: Thanksgiving in New York
text: Nice location for the hotel. The staff were very helpful and attentive. We had trouble with our heater and they sent someone up to fix it 5 minutes after we called. They had to change out the unit and volunteered to install it while we were out so they didn’t get in our way. The only thing I didn’t realize when I booked our room is that it didn’t include a fridge. Only downside, so overall it was a great stay!

title: Macy’s Day parade
text: It does not always happen, but I was so thrilled at noon when a room was ready so we could start our sight seeing in NYC. Everyday when we returned our bed was made w new towels. Great experience !!!!

title: Thanksgiving thanks!
text: Terrific Front Desk staff. Two blocks from Grand Central, conveniently located Midtown on the east side. Everything is walkable. The towels could be a little bigger and a lot softer. But having coffee, tea and hot chocolate 24 hours complementary is a bonus. Business office is very convenient but located in the basement. Cell reception is zero down there. Breakfast is ok.

title: Good choice
text: Good location, friendly and helpfull staff, pleasent breakfast, (But at least free, unlikely most hotels in nyc). Our room was small but cozy and clean! Very good location, near Many restaurants and a cvs. I would come back again, and I totally recommend it.

title: Não voltaria!
text:
Boa localização. O banheiro era pequeno mas com um bom chuveiro. A limpeza dos quartos deixou a desejar e o café da manhã era bem fraco. O hotel não possui bar, não tem geladeira no quarto e a máquina de gelo em nosso andar não funcionava. 
Sem possibilidade de antecipar o check-in.

title: A good stay
text: I've generally enjoyed the stay. The staff are friendly and courteous. The rooms are clean. Two suggestions: that breakfast...it should definitely be improved... completely tasteless. Another one is valet parking - it shouldn't be taking that long to get your car back. The rest is all good.

title: 4 giorni di serenità
text:
Soggiornato per 4 giorni è causa ritardo siamo arrivati in piena notte
Siamo sta accolti con entusiasmo, durante il soggiorno il personale si è dimostrato 
Molto cortese e gentile disponibile indicandoci i luoghi da visitare consigliandoci i mezzi per poter arrivarci.
,

title: NYC weekend
text: This property is wonderful-clean and a great location close to Grand Central.  The front desk staff made us feel at ease and welcomed.  Breakfast was a wonderful plus. Within walking distance to Rockefeller Center, Bryant Park, Times Square and so many restaurants and coffee shops.

title: Buen equilibrio costo-beneficio
text:
Buena ubicación del hotel, limpio y cómodo. Incluye desayuno y wifi en cortesía, lo cual es un buen plus.

Calle poco transitada, poco ruido exterior. Me he hospedado ahí en varias ocasiones y es muy práctico.

title: Great at all levels
text: Superbly placed, short walk to Grand Central and 15 minutes from Times Square. Staff are fantastic, nothing is too much trouble.Rooms spotless, breakfast is ample and good, saves a fortune on dining out for breakfast. Bed very large and very comfortable and changed daily along with towels. Really can’t fault this hotel at all. Far exceeded our expectations  Would definitely stay again

title: Great Location
text: The Hampton Inn Manhattan Grand Central is in the heart of midtown Manhattan. Less than a 10 minute walk from Grand Central Terminal. It is a wonderful location for shopping, restaurants, Bryant Park and more. We were warmly welcomed by Ashley and Keily.  Rooms are well kept. Some breakfast choices change daily. The hotel is due for a renovation.

title: Great stay in NYC!
text: We chose this hotel for its location: a short walk from Times Square, Rockefeller Center and the Empire State Building, yet on a more quiet street. The complimentary breakfast is a nice start of the day. The staff was very friendly. The room was big enough for the 3 of us (the double bed was a bit small for 2 but we managed).

title: Another great Hampton Inn property!
text: I came in town to view a Broadway show Saturday night and stayed at this nearby Hampton Inn. Once again, I was not disappointed with the Hampton Inn brand. The property was clean and the staff friendly.

title: Family trip
text: Excellent location directly down 43rd ave from grand central. Excellent location when traveling with children having breakfast and being so close to subway and the m15 bus on second ave is very convenient

title: Our go-to hotel from now on, in Manhattan
text:
We could not have been happier with this hotel. Ashley was able to check us in early, and was super helpful and friendly our entire stay. What we liked:
- Grab and go breakfast bags, for those who have to leave in a hurry
- Free bottled water
- Great decor throughout, very clean room and public spaces, modern style
- Excellent hot breakfast foods on the buffet
- Coffee available 24/7
- Comfy room, and spacious by NYC standards. Closet was well equipped, with hangers that come out :), a safe, iron and board, and luggage rack. HVAC was not obnoxious. Lots of outlets. Good TV. Nightstands on both sides of bed. Nice bedding and great pillows. Extra blanket in a drawer.
- Great bathroom. Broad counter, shelf for storage, nightlight, Neutrogena products, shave shelf in the shower, toilet has lid (nothing falling in), eco flush, hooks on the wall, plenty of towels and towel bars, decent lighting for makeup, no combo light/fan (so you can turn on the light without waking up your partner), easy shower controls, sink bowl large enough to soak your head.
- Good location near Grand Central. Also close to 2nd - easy to get a cab there.
My only teeny, tiny complaint was that the creamer for the 24/7 coffee was flavored. There was no other option. During breakfast there were half and half and skim milk also available. ( I am picky about my coffee. I usually carry no-chill creamers with me, but forgot them on this trip.)
We will definitely stay here again.

title: Great location; well maintained
text: Great location, 2 blocks from Grand Central station.  Well-maintained rooms(although on the smaller side).  Breakfasts good/plenty variety.  Front-desk staff and housekeeping staff excellent.  Would stay there again.

title: Non all'altezza delle attese
text: usiamo spesso gli hotel Hilton e conoscendo il loro livello europeo siamo rimasti un po' sconcertati da questo hotel prenotato come hilton, ma che sta ad un livello parecchio inferiore. Certo siamo a Manhattan, in ottima posizione, ma non c'è neppure una vera hall, la struttura è datata, così come l'arredamento, le camere sono piuttosto piccole e l'assistenza clienti è al minimo. Per non parlare della colazione che di solito all'Hilton è un must. Siamo stati costretti a farla fuori, dopo la prima esperienza. Per completare avevamo un termoconvettore molto rumoroso che per tutta la notte ci teneva compagnia. Direi che per il prezzo pagato è decisamente insufficiente

title: Amazing
text:
Hôtel idéalement situé près de Grand Central et accès metro.
Personnel souriant, disponible et très aimable et serviable.
Chambre propre et spacieuse pour 4.
Literie confortable.
Possibilité de prendre 1 boisson chaude à tout moment de la journée (très appréciée après 1 journée de balade, shopping ou s'il fait froid)
Petit déjeuner extra
A essayer sans hésiter

title: Excellent place
text: A good hotel eith all necesary, excellent poin in New York close to Gran Central Manhattan 2 blocks, ellent attention I will comebackclose to Square Garden walking. God breakfast clean and excellent attention I will comeback

title: NYC
text: Not far from Grand Central Station, made it nice to move around the city. very small rooms, I stay in  Hampton Inns all over the country, by far the smallest Hampton Inn room I've stayed in. If I were to do it again, I'd spend a little more to get a bigger room.

title: Номер не соответствовал категории бронирования
text: Отель выбирали из-за номера с балконом. Но при заезде  номера забронированной категории не оказалось, хотя накануне списали предоплату. Персонал к этому отнёсся равнодушно. Денег взяли, как за более дорогой, еще и депозит в половину стоимости списали. Разблокировать обещали в течении 5-20 рабочих дней. Номер был маленький, не было мини бара. Душ неудобный.

title: Ottimo Hotel ma..
text:
Ho soggiornato presso questo hotel per 12 giorni.
Posizione centrale, vicino alla stazione Grand Central, un po' lontano dalla baldoria serale essendo circondato solo da palazzi di uffici. 
Le camere molto spaziose, dotate di condizionatore. Non c'era il minibar. Pulizia giornaliera IMPECCABILE! 
Bagno spazioso con una doccia immensa! 
Unica pecca della nostra stanza, essendo al secondo piano proprio sopra l'entrata dell'hotel, avevamo due fari puntati che facevano illuminazione a giorno pure alle 2 di notte. E la luce passava anche dalla tenda. E i muratori che stavano sistemando l'edificio davanti di notte (ok, non è colpa dell'hotel, ma erano comunque fastidiosi... Tra loro e la luce dormire era un po' un impresa x'D) 

La colazione lasciava un po' a desiderare: uova, salsiccia, patate, ogni mattina per il salato. 
Pastine crema cioccolato per il dolce. 
Banane o mele, arance fisse, yogurt. 
Succo di frutta e una macchinetta per fare i waffle. Per tutti. Così come il tostapane... Uno per tutti con file interminabili. 
Più angolo caffè americano. 
Non era male ma nemmeno eccezionale! 

Valutazione complessiva molto buona. Personale gentile e disponibile. Pulizia ottima. Zona tranquilla. Risceglierei quest'hotel per un viaggio di affari, ma per avere un po' piu di movimento e girare per turismo ne scegliere uno in un altra zona, tipo Soho o Greenwich!

title: Localização excepcional
text:
Considero excelente o custo benefício desse hotel. 
Quando comecei a pesquisar, verifiquei que a maioria dos hotéis em Manhattan tem uma taxa de resort além do depósito usual. Isso encarece em quase 30% os já altos preços de Manhattan. Esse hotel não tem. 
Quarto e banheiro limpos, boa roupa de cama e banho, café da manhã incluído na diária e localização realmente sensacional, ao lado da Grand Central.
Recomendo esse hotel.

title: Good location, excellent value and staff
text:
First time in NY and was impressed with location of hotel, we prefer to walk as much as possible and felt the hotel offered a great base to explore.
As many others have remarked the front desk staff were really friendly, welcoming and helpful throughout our stay.
We had a good view of the Chrysler building from our room balcony, the room was small but great value. The breakfast had many options, it could get a bit busy around the single toaster but we always had enough to eat and always found a table. Free beverages all day is a nice touch.
All in all we had a great stay.

title: Great value for money
text:
Stayed here as a couple for 4 nights. Very attentive staff, I had enquired about the possibility of a fridge before we arrived and they were able to provide one. Room was clean, bathroom clean and good size shower. Basic breakfast but was perfectly adequate. 5 minute walk to Grand Central, great location to get anywhere.
Would recommend.

title: Hampton Inn
text: Perfect location.   Staff were very friendly.  Good breakfast with variety of hot and cold food. Would definitely stay here again if came back to New York. Complimentary drinks 24 hours a day which was great.

title: Good location, helpful staff.
text: Comfortable room, great location, very nice and helpful staff.  My only problem was a room freshener spray used by housekeeping that left a sweet smell in the room which I didn't care for but may not bother others.  The windows opened to provide fresh air and clear the smell.

title: Très bon établissement
text: Hôtel au bon rapport qualité/prix. Emplacement idéal proche de la gare ferroviaire Grand Central (Midtown) avec station de métro. Petit déjeuner varié et copieux. Chambre propre et spacieuse avec une bonne literie. Employés très serviables et à l'écoute. Service de bagagerie. Salle de fitness au sous-sol.

title: Perfect for a sightseeing visit
text: We stayed for 3 nights. Staff couldn’t have been more helpful when we arrived 3 hours too early to help us get checked in. Rooms were adequate but clean and great value for money. There was a good variety of food for breakfast and it was regularly replenished. It’s less than two blocks to Grand Central and the subway and there is a decent variety of bars and restaurants within a short walk. It’s not especially touristy so relatively quiet nearby - I slept well each night. Overall, I’d recommend unless you have strong feelings about size of room or level of luxury.

title: small rooms but good value and good location
text:
Family trip with our parents and our kids. 
Location is perfect, 2 blocks away from Grand Central Terminal, 15 minutes walk from Times Square..
Room was a bit tight for 4 (parents + 2 kids) especially beds (130 cm I guess)..
Breakfast is generous, which is a real advantage and good savings for a family of 6 .

title: A bit tired but good overall, especially location.
text: Stayed here 4 nights. Excellent location beside grand Central Station.Room a bit small but good ensuite. Bedroom furniture oldish, plastic cutlery at breakfast but good food. Very helpful and friendly staff.

title: Very Nice Place to stay
text: We arrived 3 of us just to shop and see the city . The desk staff held our bags early for us. they could not have been nicer. The rooms are very clean . Had a great Time ! I would stay at this location again.

title: Site seeing
text: Delightful staff and very helpful. Rooms were spotless, bed & pillows were very comfortable. The day we checked out we had a circle line cruise in the morning.  No problem, they held our luggage until we returned. I would recommend this  hotel.

title: Sights of NYC
text: Had a great time in NYC with my family. This is my second stay at Hampton Inn - Grand Central Manhattan and it was just as great as the last time. Very quiet inside the hotel and although the rooms are small it was just fine for our needs. The location is terrific!

title: Great hotel, minutes from Times Square and the water
text:
Very nice hotel, 15 minutes from Times Square. Clean, quiet, well-maintained.
Only downside is that the bathroom sliding door does not close properly (and it not built flush against the wall), you can see inside from either side so it provides essentially zero privacy or soundproofing.
Surprised to see this from a Hampton Inn

title: Ottima soluzione
text: Hotel situato in una buona posizione e tra l'altro vicino al Gran terminal dal quale partono numerosi mezzi. Camere un pò piccole ma pulite e confortevoli. Personale disponibile ed attento alle più diverse esigenze. Prima colazione varia ma ripetitiva e non tanto adatta alle abitudini italiane. Molto utile la stanza con pc e stampante situata vicino alla palestra. Letto king comodo per tre persone. Bagno funzionale e tenuto sempre bene. Consigliato

title: Super voyage à New York
