Right as you walk in, there's cucumber and lemon water and free homemade yummy chocolate chip cookies.They were so good that my children wanted a break from sightseeing & go back to the hotel just to get a cookie. Plenty of breakfast items to choose from: waffles, omelets, bagels, yogurt, cereal, toast, sausage links/patties. Each day, there was something different. I am so thankful they had free computer & printing service cause I has to print most of my tour tickets. All around clean hotel, clean room. Plenty of space in the room. Hotel is 2 blocks from Grand Central. If you plan to use the subway as much as I did, buy the weekly or multi-day pass. Trust me you'll need it. Also, a block away from hotel on 43rd heading towards grand central is a pizza place that sells very good cheese pizza for 99cents per slice.
Special thanks to Desi, Imelda, Mr Luis, Delfino and to the entire Hampton Inn Grand Central Staff

title: Girls weekend
text: I used some Hilton Points to have a girls weekend with some old friends.  We were pleasantly surprised by how big the room was, and how friendly the staff was.  Super convenient to Grand Central as well, especially helpful coming in from MetroNorth.

title: Clean , Convenient, Friendly
text:
This is a fairly typical Hampton Inn (which is a compliment).  It was clean and well-priced, it is conveniently located, and the staff was friendly and efficient.

My room was of average size for Manhattan, neither cramped nor notably spacious.

Will stay again.

title: excellent hotel with excellent service and location
text:
I enjoyed my stay very much 

Its an excellent hotel with excellent service and location 

If you travel or in Manhattan for business you should choose this small hotel near Grand Central

Breakfast was standard and ok. But for a coffe and something to grap its perfect

I will definetly stay here again

title: Good stay in Midtown.
text: Good location and value in Manhattan.  Recommend this hotel for a short to medium stay in Midtown. Terrific Italian/Steak place across the street and easy access to Time Square. Rooms are comfortable and decent size given Manhattan.

title: Nice Stay
text: Great staff and clean room.  Was on the 21st floor and the room was quiet.  The breakfast had a lot options to choose from.  In the evening they had cookies available at the front desk and 24 hour coffee service in the lounge area.  Very modern sleeping room.

title: Amazing staff!!
text: My wife and I went to NYC for a short stay and our time at this hotel was fantastic!! The room was clean and comfortable, and the staff was so friendly! We had the pleasure of speaking with Alisha, and she was incredibly helpful and knowledgeable about the area. We're so glad that we chose to stay there!

title: Hotel Bom, mas um pouco longe da Time Square
text:
O hotel era perto do Grand Central Terminal, tem café da manhã incluso e ofereciam garrafas de água e cookies na recepção, além de café e chocolate o dia todo.

O quarto era um pouco pequeno e o hotel é distante da Time Square à pé.

title: Great hotel!
text: Excellent location! Great price and breakfast was superb. It was so easy to get to it, felt safe even walking to the hotel at night. A lot of eateries around. Excellent to get to Grand Central Station like, 5 minutes walking. Near everything!

title: Muy buena opción en Manhattan
text: Nos alojamos con mi familia, matrimonio y 2 hijos adolescentes, por 5 noches en Navidad. Y fue una excelente elección. El hotel se encuentra muy bien ubicado, a unos 300 metros de Grand Central Terminal, en donde pasan gran cantidad de líneas de metro y a una distancia muy razonable a pie de Times Square, 5ta. Avenida, Bryant Park, Public Library y Naciones Unidas. El personal de recepción es muy cordial y profesional, siempre con una sonrisa y tratando de colaborar en todo. El desayuno, con opciones frías y calientes,  es bastante completo. Algunos días el lugar y el personal del desayuno, muy cordial también,  se encuentran desbordados pero siempre pudimos desayunar sin mayores problemas. La habitación es un poco chica, lo mismo que el baño, pero normalmente solo la ocupábamos para descansar por la noche y para eso cumple perfectamente. Muy bien la limpieza diaria y el servicio de wifi gratuito. También muy bueno el poder disponer las 24hs. del día bebidas calientes como café, té y chocolatada, junto con unas ricas cookies de chocolate. Sin dudas muy buena opción con una tarifa más que razonable para Manhattan.

title: Five out of five
text:
Temperatures dipped as low as -9 for our New York trip, which is hard weather going - even for a couple of visitors from Ireland.
But when you find yourself walking from Grand Central, up 43rd Street, after a day's sightseeing (or a night out) and find yourself saying 'We're nearly home', should give you some indication of the warmth and welcome you're guaranteed at this great spot.
Like most visitors, we were on a budget (their competitive prices, considering their  near ideal midtown Manhattan location has, I'm sure, been highlighted by other reviewers), but even with more to spare, I would have no hesitation in making the Hampton my first choice for future visits this great city.
The staff too were incredible, and only added to what was already the most memorable of NYC experiences. 
Already looking forward to the next visit.

title: Una gran experiencia
text: La localización, el ambiente y la comodidad excelente. El trato de los empleados fue el mejor, todos muy atentos y respetuosos. Un buen desayuno y café y chocolate caliente 24 horas... Unas riiicas galletas de 1:00 @ 9:00pm . Habitación cómoda y limpia. No humedad y siempre limpio.

title: Nicola
text:
We chose this hotel due to excellent location, just 2 blocks from Grand Central and a 15 minute walk to Times Square, and the price was well worth it. When we arrived we found the staff really helpful and courteous.
The room was very clean ample enough size for the 2 of us and a very comfortable bed. Linen was fresh every day. 
Breakfast was great for variety and the cookies, water and take out bags at reception was a very nice touch. 
Will definitely stay again. 
Thank you for making our trip so enjoyable.

title: Chosen for Price, will Return for the Service
text:
NYC is always expensive, so selected Hampton Inn for its reasonable rates for a 4-day getaway. Expected the room to be small. It was. It was also clean and comfortable. What we hadn’t anticipated was the consistent cheer, warmth, and helpfulness of the front desk staff. When we checked in they were hit with a slew of arrivals. Even as the phone rang repeatedly they were unflappable, welcoming  each of us courteously. Much as we enjoyed our adventures around the city, we looked forward to our return to the hotel each evening because of the greetings that awaited us and the discussions we enjoyed about what we’d been up to and ideas about what to do next. 
Location is great, just a few blocks east of Grand Central Station and close to many bus lines. Also close to the UN. 
Breakfast is standard motel fare, but the chocolate chip cookies set out daily from 1:00 to 9:00 are hard to beat.

title: Great place to stay on the East Side of Manhattan
text: When we take weekend trips to NYC we usually stay on the West Side.  This time we wanted to avoid congestion in that area and looked for a bargain price on the East Side.  A little looking found us the Hampton Inn—Grand Central.  As the name says, it is a short distance from Grand Central. Just go out the Lexington Avenue entrance and continue on to East 43rd Street and you’re there.  We were greeted by a fantastically upbeat front desk staff. We were there early and our room wasn’t ready yet, but the staffer found us another room and we were quickly checked in.  The person at the desk even sang along with me to a song from the Sound of Music. (I’m certain that’s not in her job description.) The room, 1605, faced 43rd street and yes, there is traffic and construction noise. It’s hard to get away from noise in this part of town.  The room itself was small, but it had everything we needed. There was a safe in the closet and that was much appreciated. The rooms don’t have refrigerators, but they will bring you one if you ask. (Our room may have been too small to put one in.) Breakfast was the typical Hampton Inn fare.  The breakfast room was spacious and clean and the person in charge of it kept busy keeping everything replenished.  If the Hampton Inn breakfast isn’t your style, there are plenty of coffee shops around.   Just a note – they are keeping the rooms up. Men were there to install new carpeting in the 16th floor rooms as we were checking out.

title: Great for family
text: This was a well located, clean and friendly hotel which was perfect for our family. Staff were great and the room suprisingly large for a NYC hotel room. Our only complaint would be that the breakfast buffet was frustrating- they just couldn’t keep up with the hoards - it was exhausting to try and get any healthy food as the crowds would descend as they brought the trays out. In the future I think we will just go out for a calm enjoyable breakfast! But we will go back!

title: Great location, wonderful  staff, and comfortable!
text: The staff here were so helpful! Great location one block from Grand Central, bus and subway stops. Comfortable bed and room. Enjoyed the free water and hot drinks in the lobby after a long, cold day of sight-seeing. Preferred eating breakfast out.

title: Friendly and homely
text: Stayed here with the hubby and 2 kids and was just a pleasure from start to finish. The staff are wonderful, so friendly. They always had a greeting and a smile for you. The breakfast had enough variety, there was mornings that i didn't fancy the hot dish so I either had porridge or lovely freshly made waffles. There was fresh fruit and yogurts also. We never had bother finding a seat either. The highlight for the kids was the fresh cookies available at reception all day. There was also hot chocolate, coffee and variety of teas available near reception all day too, free of charge. The kids loved putting on their pyjamas and going down for their hot chocolate and cookie before bed. The hotel was clean, and our room was a nice size with 2 double beds. I would look forward to staying here again if we ever visit New York in the future.

title: Excellent value, location, service
text: Stayed here to be close to my office.  Better or equal experience to other Manhattan boutique hotels and much better price. Will definitely stay here again. Friendly staff, nice, comfortable, clean rooms, and breakfast with plenty of options.  I travel to Manhattan monthly and this will be my new go-to.

title: Good value but needs work
text: Two elevators for 21 floors...need I say more?? Complimentary breakfast - better get there early if you want any choices. Don't bother asking the front desk to call you a cab- that's not a service they offer. Housekeepers did a great job...room is very clean and meets needs...small but this is to be expected. Great location...quick walk to Grand Central. Very nice and friendly staff.

title: Un nido per famiglie.. e non solo!
text:
L'albergo è situato in ottima posizione a 5 minuti dalla Grand Central Station dove passano le principali linee della Subway e in prossimità del Chrysler Building. 
La nostra camera era una quadrupla di dimensioni accettabili con bagno con vasca abbastanza confortevole:vengono forniti asciugacapelli e bollitore per caffè americano. 
La colazione self service è abbondante:macchina per waffel, vari dolcetti, frutta e due piatti salati (uno a base di carne e uno di uova)  che cambiano giornalmente. 
Il valore aggiunto é rappresentato dalla possibilità di usufruire della sala mensa in qualsiasi ora del giorno con caffè e acqua calda a disposizione, in più noi per cena abbiamo preso cibo al take away e li abbiamo mangiati li. 
Ulteriore gradita sorpresa i sacchetti omaggio con mela, acqua e una merendina che sono a disposizione degli ospiti. 
Il personale è gentilissimo e disponibile. 
Ottimo rapporto qualità prezzo considerando il prezzo di circa 150$ a notte per la quadrupla con colazione. 
Altamente consigliato.

title: Great location, friendly staff and the cookies!
text: My son and I really enjoyed this hotel for our 2 day visit to the city. It is a short walk to Grand Central where you can catch the subway or the Metro. The staff was extremely friendly, the rooms were clean, and the free breakfast was good. Oh, and did I mention the warm, amazing chocolate chip cookies in the lobby?! We will definitely stay here again on our next visit.

title: Wonderful stay, great location
text: My husband, son and I enjoyed our stay in this clean, well located hotel.  Staff was very welcoming and friendly.  The building and rooms were updated and very clean.  We enjoyed the complimentary WiFi, and coffee, tea, hot chocolate station available all day.

title: 8 dicembre 2017
text:
Bell weekend ...bell Hotel 
Vicino alla grand central station quindi comodo x la metro...ma a N.Y. e' piu' bello camminare a testa in su ...tra mille colori e grattacieli vicino alla stupenda Times Square,dalla nostra camera vedevamo il Chrysler ...biscottini e acqua offerti alla receptions, personale simpatico e gentile camere belle e spaziose noi avevamo quella con 2 letti matrimoniali.....tutto super

title: Clean Hotel, Great Location, Friendly Service
text: This was a last minute booking for two nights. The price was great for the location. The room was clean, quiet and a perfect size for a couple. The front desk was helpful and friendly, even late at night. I felt safe in the area and in the hotel.

title: The staff they were great.
text: Good size room clean bathroom. We had a coffee machine well needed early morning breakfast was good... i cant forget the chocolate chip cookies they were great they are my favorite.This hotel i would recommend it to everyone it is close to everything .....The room attendant Claudia she was very attentive she took real good care of us thanks.

title: Great stay, convenient to everything
text: We had the opportunity to travel to NYC and stayed at the Hampton Inn by Grand Central. The hotel is situated so that we were able to navigate the city easily. The rooms, although a little small, are well situated and clean. The thing that stands out here is the feeling created by a very attentive staff.  We were always welcomed no matter how late in the day with a bottle of water and a friendly smile. A terrific value for the money spent.

title: Great, friendly hotel
text: This is a gem.  The room was super clean and updated.  Every staff person was so friendly and helpful!  Good breakfast, cookies all the time and a great travel snack bag for our ride home!  I will def stay here again!

title: Rapporto qualita' prezzo ottimo!
text: Posizione ottima: a 5 minuti a piedi da Grand Central(dove arrivano treni e shuttle bus da aeroporto jfk) a 15 min a piedi da Times square. Camere piccole ma con tutto l'occorrente e abbastanza pulite. Colazione americana: non e' il massimo ma ci si arrangia. Cortesia del personale ammirevole. Apprezzata la disponibilita' di bottiglie d'acqua, caffe' e bevande calde gratuitamente per tutto il giorno.

title: Excelencia hotelera
text: Es un excelente hotel donde prima exactamente la ecuación precio - calidad. Pasamos 15 días de los más fríos en New York en los últimos años y no tuvimos ningún inconveniente. Un punto a destacar es la calidez humana de sus trabajadores, dispuestos siempre a resolver, a asesorar y a despejar dudas. Un segundo punto es el acceso libre a una infusión caliente durante las 24 horas (cafés, te, chocolate, etc.).

title: Location Location Location
text: Found a little gem next to Grand Central Terminal. The employees were outstanding. We were treated with a smile. Breakfast was okay, not great a typical warmed up frozen prepared food.  The rooms were okay good NYC sized.  I would say we did have a problem with our heater, as it was either 80 degrees or blowing cold air.  Even when maintenance was called, they said just let it work.....felt like saying if it works....   We will return to this location

title: Excellent Service
text: Everyone was very helpful and professional. Extremely nice, small rooms however it was all worth it. I had some questions and was able to get all of them answered. Had great recommendations from the staff.

title: Great location!
text: This hotel was reasonably priced and one of the few in Manhattan that offer free breakfast. The location is within walking distance to many great NYC attractions. The rooms are small but we didn't spend a lot of time in our room anyway. The staff was great, and the room was clean. The maid service was fantastic. I would definitly stay there again.

title: Convenient Place to Stay
text: Nice place to stay during the Macys' Day parade held in late November! The front desk staff were great and helpful. The rooms were nice and cozy! The hotel was very close to Macys and other retail shops. We would stay here again!

title: Vacation
text:
It is a 

Thanks!!! Wonderful hotel!! The Staff was great!! Very convenient!!
Thanks!!!!
Clean !!!

Great! Great! Super! Nice!

Nice room!!!!!
I don’t have anything else to say. Why do I have to write so much???

title: Great option for staying in NYC
text: Very conveniently located (walking distance to Grand Central and the subway). By New York standards, the rooms are decent sized and affordable. The usual Hampton Inn amenities that we have come to expect. Helpful staff at reception.

title: Think Twice!
text: Although slightly more expensive than hotels that are even closer to Rockefeller Ctr, decision was solely based on breakfast offer.  Trays were empty. Chaotic! Thank god for Starbucks across the street

title: Extremely satisfied.
text: My daughter and I decided to go to New York for Christmas. I chose this hotel based on other reviews. The staff were all friendly and helpful. We felt very welcomed. The rooms were clean and very nice. The shower in the first room we had didn’t have as much water pressure as the second room we stayed in. The breakfast was good, but they were running out of things. To their credit there was one or two people checking the food supply and replenishing. Even though I would maybe prefer a different location if I go back to New York, I would probably book this hotel again because of their friendliness and great service. Loved the rooms, too.

title: quite nice BUT would never stay again
text:
The rooms are ok and not that small.
The breakfast area and the breakfast buffet by itsself can solely be described with "POOR". Lack of cleanliness and long delays before tables get cleaned.
The receptionists aren't helpful at all and seem to be stressed resp. overchallenged which results in limited courtesy. 
Obvisously one had also "certain" health related troubles.
what really bothers me was NOT GETTING ANY RESPONSE on an inquiry regarding to LOST ITEMS in the room.
An email to the contact of the hotel according to booking.com (Mrs. Imelda Castilla) describing the items and pointing out the importance remained unanswered.

How is such a behaviour corelating to so many positive reviews?
I am puzzled and doubt that all as I haven't experienced that overwhelming environment.

title: Great Location and Great Staff
text: Perfect location to visit the city. Great location to to Times Square, Broadway, Grand Central and best of all transportation by subway and Busses. Staff are so welcoming and they are always willing to help you with any concerns you may have. Breakfast is good but space is a little small. The room is perfect for a kings size  bed.

title: hampton inn grand central
text: good deal for the money, close to grand central station, free hot breakfast, very clean but small rooms. Bed comfortable no real good city view. Staff very nice. tall skinny building between 2 other buildings.

title: Good Hotel
text:
Wife & I visited for two nights ( 27/12/2017 & 28/12/2017) We were well impressed! A small & friendly Hotel - bedroom having many power points & USB phone/ computer sockets. Room small but clean & tidy with good size bathroom . Coffee making machine / Iron / Ironing Board / Hairdryer.
This Hotel does morning breakfast from 06:00 to 10:00. The breakfast room is small but comfortable with a good selection of breakfast food. Due to small breakfast area - best go for breakfast between 06:00 & 07:30 ( Before the morning rush)
Reception staff & Cleaners are all friendly & helpful.
Located about 10 Minutes from Times Square.
****If Lifts are “Busy” - the Stairs are easily accessible on all floors (Good exercise😀)

title: Great location!
text: The Hampton Inn near the UN is a very nice place for a stay. It’s clean and well appointed like I’ve come to expect from Hampton, but the real bonus is the great location. Centrally located with easy access uptown or down, and very cool to walk out of the hotel and see the Empire State Building a few short blocks away. Look the other way and there’s the UN. Makes a great base of operations for a short stay like ours (3 nights). The staff was great and we loved the hot chocolate and cookies! They shot the pic of us in the lobby. Marked down slightly for the small rooms (to be expected for the very reasonable price point) and the scratchy, thin towels. All in all a great value!

title: Great staff, noisy rooms
text: We only stayed one night in this hotel and the staff was delightful. Very friendly and helpful, even though it was Christmas Day. The from was clean, well laid out, and generally comfortable...but, the walls are paper thin and we could hear our neighbors’ conversations (even though they were just speaking normally). It made for a very difficult night’s sleep. If you don’t mind noise transmission from the halls and other rooms, this is a great property. Otherwise, I’d stay elsewhere.

title: Great personal and friendly service not expected in NYC
text: Everything about this location was top notch. More specifically each staff member was personally interested and engaged with guests. We were made to feel as if we never left our small midwestern town as this place didn’t feel as impersonal as a large city!

title: Wonderful place, Convenient to Subway
text: Everything was great at this Hampton Inn.  The front desk was amazing, the breakfast staff was great and always smiling even under the breakfast rush. This hotel is a short walk from Grand Cental Terminal.  We will use this hotel again when we go back to NYC! Oh and the .99 pizza slices on the wall from the GCT to the hotel are cheap n easy n pretty tasty as well. You know when the Police and the taxi drivers are there it has to be pretty good.

title: Very Nice Stay
text: Can't beat the location for the price.  If you can navigate the area, you'll know what I mean.  My family and I were greeted with a friendly smile by your guest service agents at the front desk.  Both agents were extremely knowledgeable and helpful.  The name escapes me from the other agent who was very helpful but the one agent's name I recall was Dashanda Cheatham.  She was extremely friendly, pleasant to talk to, and was genuinely sensitive to our needs.  Keep up the good work!  Internet outside the rooms were a little sporadic but we didn't spend much time in the facility so we never reported it.  Complimentary breakfast was also really good.

title: No es solo el Hotel, son las personas
text: El 2015 escribí una reseña, el hotel como tal es lo que tú pagas, y en eso cumple perfectamente, habitaciones cómodas, servicio de limpieza excelente, desayuno aceptable. Pero lo que realmente tiene espectacular este hotel, son las personas que trabajan, se agradece la cordialidad, siempre con una sonrisa y la mejor disposición, eso cuesta encontrar en manhattan. Destaco además a Saule por su gran preocupación de entregar un sobresaliente servicio, a Kyla por su grata forma de tratar a los huéspedes, y todo el equipo que hace un gran hotel, nos vemos en Junio del 2018 :)

title: Nice location and Happy staff room was too hot
text: We had a great stay at this location other than that the room was too hot. We alerted the staff and they said they would send the engineer to look at the heat/cooling unit and it was never fixed. The room felt like a sauna at night

title: Winter get away
text: Outstanding staff. Extremely caring and concerned for our comfort. An ideal location and value to explore and enjoy NYC. Rooms are small, but are clean and well cared for. Breakfast was included, it was very satisfying.

title: AMAZING!!!!
text: They were so accommodating and welcoming. A lady in the kitchen gave us donuts upon arrival even after breakfast had been over for hours. They provided us with free bottled water every time we entered the hotel, as well as fresh-baked cookies. The breakfast was amazing and exceeded our expectations! Rooms were clean and spacious. Overall, AMAZING!!!!

title: Clean friendly hotel
text: Hotel is located near grand central station makng it convienent getting around the city.  Front desk staff are very helpful.  Rooms are comfortable. Breakfast is not for my liking.  Not many choices. No too go bags either

title: Perfect for us
text: Perfect hotel. Great location. Very quiet. Staff friendly and helpful. Always on hand to give advise. Complientary wi fi and breakfast. We would definitely recommend staying here. Central to all key tourist sites. 5 minutes to grand central.

title: FRAUD EXPERIENCE
text: We have made a stay of 5 nights from December 7th to December 12th, at the end of the stay we have received the total bill that we had to pay. This amount did not correspond to the amount actually paid and we were informed that the other amounts (deposit and deposit made before we arrived) would be reimbursed. This has not happened yet!

title: Great Stay for a Great Price
text: We stayed here for one night.  The bag check both upon our arrival and after checkout before our departure was a quick, easy process.  The front desk ladies were super friendly and we enjoyed joking around with them.  It is a smaller hotel, only 8 rooms on each floor but we heard no noise at night from any of the surrounding rooms or hallways.  This was a great location, very close to Grand Central.  We always enjoy the free breakfast at the Hampton Inn brand hotels in NYC.  It saves both time and money.  I would definitely stay here again!

title: Warmly received and well looked after at the Hampton Inn Manhattan Grand Central
text: Enjoyed our stay at the Hampton Inn Manhattan Grand Central.  Staff were very friendly and attentive - nice and welcome in a big city like New York.  The extra little touches like cookies, some water and just a nice welcome greeting were all appreciated.  It is very central location and great for work or those on holiday.  Rooms were comfy and good size.  Thanks to all the staff.

title: A New York Christmas
text:
This is a great hotel. !!  Convenient to subway stations.  Times Square, Broadway Shows, Radio City, Rockefeller Center, 5th Avenue shops are all an easy walk. 
  The staff greeted us with smiles. Lilly at the front desk is just precious!! Always smiling and very helpful. The housekeeping staff I came in contact with where also pleasant and made sure we had everything we needed. 
I would definitely recommend this hotel. 
It was very clean, the free breakfast was good with many choices. 
My only complaint is the towels could be nicer.

title: Sisters Trip
text: My two sisters and I stayed here during my Birthday trip to NY. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms were small but clean and very comfortable. The only thing missing was a mini fridge. The complementary breakfast was great.  We stayed on the eighth floor and no trouble with noise.   Wonderful stay!

title: 50th Birthday Celebration
text: My husband took me to New York for my 50th birthday( Christmas time) since that is something I have wanted to do since I was a little girl. Of course, if you have traveled to New York during Christmas time the prices on hotels are very expensive. When I booked this Hampton Inn the price was lower than most hotels in the manhattan area. I am glad I stayed at this hotel even though this hotel doesn't have a lot of amenities. They are they typical Hampton, however, there is no vending machine for sodas or snacks. They do offer the Hampton breakfast, wifi, flavored water, checkin cookies, teas, coffee and hot chocolate always available. This hotel right outside of the craziness of times square which after seeing time square am very happy that I decided to stay on the outskirts but still close enough. It is a quick walk to Grand Central station but also walking distance to Empire State Building, Rockefeller Center and the UN building. You truly do not need to rent a car but use the subway which is $3.00 one way or $6.00 RT or a yellow taxi. I enjoyed my stay because of the staff especially the front desk gals and the gentlemen who was there the 3 nights we stayed there. They were extremely helpful and always pleasant and greeting us as we were coming in, as well as, going out. If I decide to stay at another hotel I would stay with them again because of the convenience, price and the pleasant staff. Thank you from Room $1104 Mr/Mrs Fodera

title: Our Holiday Visit
text: Perfect location if you are using Grand Central from Connecticut. The front desk staff was welcoming and informative. We were able to leave our luggage early and tour all day. When we arrived later our room was ready and check in was a breeze. The next day we our luggage was stored and ready for us to pickup to catch our train home. Our room was clean, the bed comfortable and the staff very positive. We had a great visit.

title: Great stay in NY City!
text: Great location, service, and value for a vacation stay in NYC at Christmas time with my wife. Very clean new hotel with professional and enjoyable staff.  Breakfast was great and the cookies and coffee was a plus. Location to all prime spots in NYC.  Will be my first choice on my return back next year!

title: Wondrful staff at Hampton Inn
text: Awesome all around - dining room, lobby, housekeeping!!! Thank you all for a wonderful holiday stay.  Truly appreciate the personal touches around the hotel.  Love the decorations and the chocolate chip cookies.

title: Great location in mid-town Manhattan
text: Just far enough away from the more crowded areas of Mid-town but everything is still in walking distance. Stayed there while attending a one day conference. Did not need a cab ... walked to Broadway Theater, Rockefeller Center, Times Square and the UN. Easy access off the FDR with good valet service.

title: Hampton NYC Grand Central
text: Fabulous staff from front desk to breakfast to housekeeping. The location was perfect for our needs. Fairly quiet for a midtown Manhattan property. The chocolate chip cookies were very much appreciated.  Would definitely stay there again.

title: Great staff
text:
Really close to grand central to access trains and subways. .99 cent pizza slices on way from train was better than most. Desk staff brought cookies to our room since we missed them at checkin. 
Donuts at breakfast were local bakery.  Yes, gained a pound or two.

title: Christmas visit.
text:
I found the staff so helpful and friendly. From the cookies to the tea and water, they looked after us. Even when I became ill, one employee in particular, went above and beyond to help us.
My only complaint about the Hotel, we had an adjoining room which was fine as the door was obviously locked. But the guests next door were very loud. 

All in all, we would come back! 

Many thanks.

title: Long weekend in NYC
text:
The hotel was perfect for our needs. Convenient to Grand Central, good food, Times Square, etc. Room was clean, nothing fancy, but all we needed as a base for exploring the city. The one day we took advantage of the free breakfast it wasn’t the best but, it was free and there were numerous choices-I would proablably have stuck to the cold items had we eaten there again; we chose to take advantage of the proximity to Ess-a-Bagels instead. 
The staff was great and would stay there again.

title: Great Staff - Good Hotel
text: The staff at this hotel was very friendly and accommodating. Hotel itself was perfectly fine and all 3 rooms in my party were well maintained in good working order. The location is just a few blocks from Grand Central - so the location was excellent for getting around easily.  Great stay.

title: Great location, not in such a busy area!
text: I will begin by saying that the staff members were simply the best! They were super friendly and very personable.  The rooms are comfy and cozy, not the biggest room but the space is great overall! The city view in the room we stayed in wasn’t much of a city video, although we did get to see a glimpse of the Chrysler Building from our room.  I loved that we were so close to Grand Central station and the subway.  We cannot wait to go back next year for our new Christmas Tradition!

title: Location Location Location!
text: My husband and I just stayed at the Hampton Inn for a long weekend and we had a great stay. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Our tv was not working one night and they sent an engineer up to our room within 5 mins of our call. He was able to fix it right away. The rooms are small but very clean and we were not in our room except to sleep at night so we didn't mind. Our only complaint were how thin the walls were. It definitely didn't ruin our stay, just something we wish we would have known so we could bring earplugs or a small fan to drown out some noise. The best thing about this hotel is definitely the location. We were able to walk to Times Square and Grand Central station easily. We even walked to Central Park which was a little further but very doable. Overall we had a great stay and would stay here again.

title: Good Value, Good Location, Friendly Couteous Staff
text: All staff courteous and very helpful! Great location to Grand Central and reasonable walking distance to 5th avenue Rooms comfortable, free breakfast good, offer both hot and cold items, Secure and safe!

title: Great staff, hotel average
text:
Without exception the staff were friendly, helpful and upbeat.  Our room however was pretty tired; just okay.  In addition it had a connecting door to the neighbouring room and this seemed not to be able to cut out any noise.  For this reason alone I wouldn't be able to give the hotel more than an average rating as I can't bear to listen to other people's TV and phone calls.
The hotel can access a car service to Newark and this was distinctly preferable to using the train which we did on the inbound trip.
Breakfast was adequate, though the room is rather small.  Its main advantage is saving some money in a wonderful, but expensive, city.

title: Christmas Trip
text: this hotel is very centrally located for seeing all of the midtown sights in New York.  The room was clean and comfortable and the on site breakfast is very good.  We were able to walk to Rockefeller center and also to Grand Central (two blocks away) to take the subway to lower Manhattan.

title: Just what I needed on my trip to Manhattan
text: A Hampton Inn is the Toyota Camry or Honda Accord of the hotel world.  It may not be super luxurious or chic, but you can always count on it to be dependable and consistently very good, and this is why I seek them out when looking for hotels.  My recent stay at this Hampton Inn was a good example of why I like these places.  The front desk crew was cheerful and helpful, the room was clean, quiet and comfortable, and the complimentary breakfast was nicer than many free breakfasts offered by other hotels.  The location of this hotel was perfect for my needs, being in Midtown and close to Grand Central, but on a relatively quiet side street, away from craziness of the “city that never sleeps”.  It was also very reasonably priced for the quality received.  I would definitely return to this hotel the next time I come to this part of New York.

title: Great Location and Great Staff
text: This hotel was very conveniently located. Walking distance to Grand Central Station and UN headquarters. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. The room was pretty good. 4 of stayed comfortably. They bake fresh cookies every evening and they are to die for! I will surely return to this place whenever I am in NYC again.

title: Hampton Inn Grand Central
text: Chose this hotel for an NYC holiday visit due to its proximity to Grand Central, 5th Avenue, Macy's, and Times Square. Perfect walking distance to all. Great staff, clean rooms, and free breakfast! And fresh baked chocolate cookies!

title: Karen
text: Had a wonderful time in NYC, the staff at Hampton Inn Grand Central were great especially Dashanda at the front desk. She was very helpful with directions! The hotel was clean and the breakfast was a good start in the morning for sightseeing. It was nice coming "home" after a long day of walking and seeing as much as possible to the warm cookies in tge lobby. Thanks Hamoton Inn!

title: Estupendo hotel, muy bien ubicado. El personal encantador, muchos de ellos hablan español. Desayuno muy completo.
text: Estupendo hotel, muy bien ubicado. El personal encantador, muchos de ellos hablan español. Desayuno muy completo. Nuestra habitacion silenciosa (piso 17) y eso que era habitacion con vistas a la ciudad.

title: Excellent front desk staff, convenient location to GCT
text: Easy walking distance to/from hotel /Grand Central Terminal. Stayed Fri and Sat nights  sight-seeing in NYC. Excellent front desk staff: pleasant, polite, helpful, and knowledgeable. Small room but typical for a lot of Manhattan hotels. Room clean and in good repair. Very loud talking neighbor in adjoining room on Fri night was very bothersome as we could hear every word he said in animated telephone calls. Different occupant on Saturday was not a problem. Breakfast area was very busy both mornings but the staff worked diligently to keep the area stocked and clean. I would stay here again but request a non-adjoining room.  GF thought bed was hard but I had no issues with it.

title: Perfect place to stay in NYC
text:
Hotel is a perfect location to stay in the city. Quieter neighborhood away from the craziness. Short walk to Grand Central station and convenient location to Rockefeller, Radio City music hall and Times Square. Great Mexican restaurant 2 blocks away, Sinigual. Room was spotless and the staff was amazing. We were pleasantly acknowledged every time walking in and out of the hotel.  We enjoyed a nice selection for breakfast every morning. They also offer bottled water, fruit infused water and amazing cookies every day along with hot coffee, tea,
hot chocolate 24 hours a day. Perfect stay for my family. Next time in the city, we will be back!

title: Solid, no-frills Manhattan hotel
text: We enjoyed our experience staying at the Hampton Inn Grand Central.   There is nothing fancy or over the top about this hotel, but it is clean, modern and has a pretty good location.  By the far the best part of the hotel is the front desk staff.  They were always super friendly, even early in the morning or late at night.  They offered bottles of water and snacks to us every evening and even went and found us fresh baked cookies when they had run out.   You never know what kind of attitudes you might get in a NYC hotel, but I can say that the people working at the Hampton Inn were the best!  They also have the usual Hampton Inn breakfast, which is typical of Hampton Inn.  We were there during Thanksgiving week and the hotel was fully booked, but we never had a problem with lines.    This hotel is a short walk to Grand Central and Bryant Park.  It's also walkable to Times Square (about 15 minutes) and Rockefeller Center.  We even walked to Central Park.    The only downside is that the rooms are small.  This is typical for NYC, but we did find that for a family of 4, with 4 suitcases, it was a tight squeeze.   We also had a strange air flow situation where the draft from under the door created an air tunnel type of noise.  Once we figured this out we had to put towels under the door to keep the room quiet. (if you are in room 1802, beware of this!)  Overall this is a good hotel for a vacation in the city, as long as you don't mind simplicity and really nice people!

title: Decent, convenient place to stay in Manhattan
text: The room was spotless and comfortable, but small, as Manhattan hotel rooms generally are. I had to unpack everything into the wardrobe and dresser as soon as I got there because the only space available to open up a suitcase was the bed. My only quibbles are that I could hear water in the pipes from the next room, which woke me up a couple of times during the night, and that the breakfast buffet was mediocre: the scrambled eggs were dry, and there was only one meat choice on a given day (though they varied it from day to day).

title: Very good
text: Hotel moderno,camera di dimensioni decenti con un discreto bagno! La colazione è più che sufficiente anche se lo spazio è un po’ ridotto sia per sedersi sia per servirsi!l’unica cosa che non mi è piaciuta è la zona ma è del tutto personale,in quanto sono stata più volte a NY e preferisco spendere un po’ di più ma essere in posizione più centrale per muovermi meglio a piedi! Ma per il resto davvero un ottimo hotel

title: perfect base for NYC
text:
First of all, the people at the front desk were amazing: always smiling, ready to help and very generous with the free bottled water:) Check-in and check-out were a breeze, they also arranged for a car to take me to the airport which was fast and comfortable. 
The room is OK in terms of size (i even had place for my huge suitcase, but i was alone in the room...), clean with comfortable bed. Bathroom was decent size, also.
The two elevators can be slow at busy times (i think there are around 20 floors...), but the free coffee, tea, hot chocolate and infused ice water offered 24 hours a day in the lobby (plus the warm cookies in the afternoon) can make the wait more manageable. 
The breakfast is quite standard, there was plenty of seating when I was there. 
As for location, it is very good for tourism: 5 min walk to Grand Central, 15 min walk 5th avenue, 15 min walk to times square. Also, at Grand Central you have a hub of transportation, including many subway lines, so you can get everywhere. As for the area around, there are a few restaurants in the vicinity and even more restaurants and bars in a 10 min walk radius. 
All in all, very nice place especially compared to other hotels in the same price range. If next time i find myself in NYC, there is availability i wouldn't hesitate.

title: Melhor atendimento!!!
text: O hotel é o Hampton tradicional, mas com instalações antigas, o que nos surpreendeu foi o atendimento de todos os funcionários, seria injusto dar o nome de algum pois todos fizeram de tudo para que nossa estadia fosse excelente, nos sentimos em casa!!! Recomendo

title: Excellent Hotel and Location
text: The location of the hotel was amazing, it was right by Grand Central Station and it was not too noisy or crowded.  The hotel staff was amazing and went out of their way to make sure that I was accommodated no matter what time of day.  The rooms and bathrooms were very clean.

title: Great customer service
text: Great customer service and we even got to check in early. They also held our bags for us while we waited for our room. It was very clean, quiet, and the breakfast was all you can eat. The bathroom was also clean and they had fresh cookies in the lobby everyday (but get there early since they go fast). You can also request free bottled water from the front desk. Get to breakfast early because it gets crowded. This hotel is perfectly located and only a few blocks from grand central station!

title: A week in New York City
text: We had a wonderful stay at the Hampton Inn Manhattan Grand Central.  The hotel is very clean, all staff very friendly including one lady named Shanique Osbourne who went out of her way multiple times to ensure we had a great stay.  The hotel is very convenient to the subway and a great price for a NY visit.  The breakfast was very good, lots to chose from and very well attended by staff.  5 Star experience.

title: Grand Central NY
text: Nice hotel location but off the main path.  Easy access to subway and walking distance to mid-town NYC.  Friendly staff.   Clean rooms with an accommodating layout.     Staff was not prepared for busy time - ran out of breakfast items on many days.   Staff was unable to adjust lobby music which blared loudly in the late evening.

title: Good location
text: This hotel is clean and only a block and a half from Grand Central. Depending on your room, you may have a good view or not. Views do not matter to me.The front desk staff was very friendly. Easy access to go up or downtown on the Lexington line.

title: Great location for UN Building
text: Just a short nice walk to the UN Building and the Central Station. Nice room and well equipped. Good internet connection and very friendly staff. Breakfast is complementary but quite limited. It deserves to be improved to be in line with other services of the hotel.

title: A great value for your money
text: Excellent hotel, awsome staff and hot breakfast. You don’t find that to common in a hotel at NYC. The staff made sure that our family stayed was worthy. We were always received with a smile no matter the hour at night.

title: As Expected
text:
NYC hotel rooms are notoriously small so we didn’t have “big” expectations. I frequent Hampton Inns as they are usually a good value and this was the case with this hotel. Small closet and bathroom, not much space beyond the double beds and desk but nicely furnished and clean. Windows are well sound proofed (43rd is a fairly quiet block too). The fact that Hampton Inn makes a point of changing duvets (or at least the covers) is a big seller for me. Overall, perfectly adequate. 

The breakfast is your typical Hampton Inn selection, tasty and plentiful... 1-2 rotating hot choices (omelettes, scrambled eggs, sausage, bacon, potatoes, French toast sticks), make your own waffles (my kids always love this) breads/pastries, yogurt, fruit, hard boiled eggs, coffee, tea, cocoa, juice and water... if you can’t find something to satisfy you, than you’re clearly too fancy for Hampton. 

I have found Hampton Inn staff members to usually be helpful and friendly and this was the case here. They were able to accommodate a very early check-in (I never expect it and always appreciate it), they saved a few cookies for my kids when we returned after a long day, and were great with my kids. They always welcomed us back upon our return. They were generous with the bottled water as well. 

The fitness and business centers are as to be expected as well: clean and well maintained. 

A washer/dryer would have been nice to do a quick load but in NYC it was easy enough to find a fluff n fold. The $15 isn’t much more than a load would’ve been and was certainly easier (they offered same day service and delivery for a premium, but next day was fine) 

Helpful hint... the 01 and 02 rooms are right next to the ice machines (which are not enclosed or in an alcove) so you will hear it.  With 8 rooms on a floor it shouldn’t be too much of an issue but as luck would have it 3-4 days of our stay someone got ice at 5:15AM. The wife and kids slept through it but I heard it... I don’t blame the Hotel for that, but they easily could service 2-3 floors with a single machine and reduce the likelihood of guest complaints.

title: Great Stay in NYC for Thanksgiving
text: Location of this Hampton Inn is conveniently located.  It's a relatively short walk to Times Square and Central Park.  We made the walk from lower Manhattan (World Trade Center) but it's about 3 miles.  The hotel itself is clean and the staff is incredibly friendly.  The rooms are a bit tight but it is NYC so unless you are paying top dollar you're not going to get huge rooms.  Rooms are clean and in good working order.  Beds are comfortable.  Walls are a bit thin so we did have to pound on the wall to get our neighbors to quiet down at 3 a.m.  Overall, I'd recommend staying here.

title: Gem.....
text: Been to many hotels across this great land of ours and this Hampton is a gem. Wonderful staff, great location, nice rooms, very clean and nice hot breakfast...wow.  Not a five star hotel to some but 6 star to me..

title: Primer viaje a New York.
text: Muy satisfecho con el Hotel, todo fue excelente desde el personal que trabaja en el mismo, hasta las condiciones del hotel en general, solo el servicio Wifi no pude usarlo pues era muy lento. El resto fue una maravillosa experiencia.

title: Great location and clean hotel
text: The hotel has a great location near Grand Central Terminal and good restaurants.  The staff is very friendly and helpful and willing to go the extra mile for guests.  Each afternoon the hotel offers fresh-baked cookies -- an unexpected and added bonus.

title: Central Location; so convenient
text: Located a few blocks from Grand Central, numerous subway stops, Times Square and great restaurants. Loved being able to walk to most places. Small room but clean with all amenities, including a hot breakfast in the morning.very friendly staff.

title: excellent, clean hotel good for families
text: Hotel is good value for families!  Good location...nice to have breakfast included and a good selection.  Parking was not as expensive as many of the other New York hotels.  A nice feature is the chocolate chip cookies upon checkin and bottled water included.

title: Great Hotel Location and Super Friendly Staff
text: This hotel is located close to Grand Central Station.  The lobby was very clean, along with the rooms.  I had a room towards the back of the hotel, allowing for a quiet night sleep. The front receptionist staff was very friendly, as they always welcomed each guest upon their return to the hotel.  The fresh cookies in the lobbies was also a nice treat!  The breakfast each morning was fresh and nicely presented.  Overall, a wonderful hotel in a very accessible midtown location!

title: Excelente opción de hospedaje en NYC
text: A tan solo dos cuadras de Grand Central, lugar tranquilo, en términos generales excelente servicio de todos los empleados del hotel pero, quiero reconocer a Eliza y Chandra quienes tuvieron un detalle espectacular al informarles del cumpleaños de mi esposa. Desayuno abundante y variado, habitación doble con cama extra grande cómoda y confortable. Volvería sin dudarlo.
